job_title: Entry Level Software Developer - No Experience Required
job_text:
One day someone is going to ask you where you got your start…This is IT!
With a wide range of Fortune 500 enterprises, government organizations and top systems integrators as our clients, we not only provide you with the skills needed to succeed through an employer-paid training program  but will also give you the opportunity to put those skills to use, on projects that matter.
What We Are Looking For
College degree (Associates or Bachelors)
Must be authorized to work in the US
Strong desire to learn to code – No prior professional experience required. 
A natural problem solver
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Willing to relocate anywhere in the US – Relocation assistance provided
What We Offer
Competitive salary
Relocation & housing assistance
Health, vision & dental insurance
Paid time off
Industry Certifications
Life Insurance Policy
401k
Mentoring program and ongoing support throughout your entire Revature career
Experience with the largest and most reputable companies in the US
Apply Today. Interviews are going on now.#SoftwareEngineering
Equal Employment Opportunity
The Company is an equal opportunity employer. We will extend equal opportunity to all individuals without regard to race, religion, color, sex, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected under applicable federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, benefits, compensation and training. If you require an accommodation to work based on any of these protected factors, please notify the Human Resources Department, and the Company will evaluate the request and provide an accommodation in accordance with applicable law.
We seek to comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws related to discrimination and will not tolerate the interference with the ability of any of the Company’s employees to perform their job duties. Our policy reflects and affirms the Company’s commitment to the principles of fair employment and the elimination of all discriminatory practices. job_title: Retail Supervisor Part Time Now Hiring
job_text:
Style is never in short supply at our more than 1,000 TJ Maxx stores. They all have different products, but the same commitment to the thrill of the find. From designers straight off the runway to statement jewelry, we offer exciting surprises that make the everyday a little more fun. Same with working here. Our environment is ever-changing, yet always encouraging. Each shift is a new opportunity to Discover Different.
Posting Notes: TJ Maxx Store 0241 || 360 Barnstable Rd. || Hyannis || MA || 02601
 Job Summary:  
 Responsible for promoting an excellent customer experience. Oversees a team of Associates at front of store ensuring prompt, courteous customer service and promotion of loyalty programs. Leads by example by engaging and interacting with all customers, and maintaining a clean and organized store. 
 Responsibilities: 
  Role models exceptional customer service   Creates a positive internal and external customer experience   Promotes a culture of honesty and integrity; maintains confidentiality   Takes an active role in training and mentoring Associates on front end principals using appropriate company resources and tools   Trains and coaches Associates on personalizing the customer experience while promoting loyalty programs   Assigns registers, supports and responds to POS coverage needs, and coordinates breaks for all Associates   Addresses customer concerns and issues promptly, ensuring a positive customer experience   Ensures Associates execute tasks and daily activities in accordance with store plan; reprioritizes as needed   Communicates accurately and effectively with management and Associates when setting and addressing priorities; provides periodic progress updates   Provides and accepts ongoing recognition and constructive feedback   Partners with Management on Associate training needs to increase effectiveness   Ensures adherence to all labor laws, policies, and procedures   Promotes credit and loyalty programs during customer interactions   Supports and participates in store shrink reduction goals and programs   Promotes safety awareness and supports maintenance of a risk-free environment   Performs other duties as assigned  
 Requirements: 
  Available to work flexible schedule to support business needs, including nights and weekends.   Strong understanding of merchandising techniques   Capable of handling multiple tasks at one time   Strong organizational skills with attention to detail   Ability to respond appropriately to changes in direction or unexpected situations   Team player, working effectively with peers and supervisors to accomplish tasks   Strong communication skills   Ability to train others   One year retail and 6 months of leadership experience.  
At TJ Maxx there’s so much potential to discover something new. A new day means new merchandise, and a fresh chance to reinvent retail. Discover Different means that we want you to bring your whole self and your sense of style to work with you every day - just as Associates do throughout the entire TJX family, which includes Marshalls, HomeGoods, Sierra, and Homesense.
Discover Different also means we embrace each other’s differences and unique perspectives. We consider all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, gender identity and expression, marital or military status. We also provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act and applicable state and local law.

Maximus is currently seeking a  .Net Developer to work remotely to focus on the development of  a Medicaid Provider Data Management System.   The position  r  esponsible for the development and finalization of all technical system documentation in relation to the data management system.   
 
  Primary Responsibilities:  
  Focus on development of a Medicaid Provider Data Management System working directly with other Sr.NET developers, business analysts and testers   Maintain and modify software programs and perform software design and development, unit testing, and debugging of software code   Defect correction   Design, develop and test software components, and document and diagram application functionality from business requirements   Participate in design and code reviews   Develop custom adapters allowing the integration of legacy (i.e., capabilities not developed as services) capabilities with service-based Framework infrastructure and services   Primary point of contact for assigned technical deliverables   Ensure development activities are aligned with scope, schedule, priority and business objectives   Meet or exceed all operational readiness requirements (e.g., operations engineering, performance)   Ensure all tasks and milestones associated with technical design, development and unit testing are completed according to project management guidelines   Ensure that product configurations and enhancements are made correctly and deployed per our release management plan   Responsible for the development and finalization of all technical system documentation  
Minimum Requirements:
 Bachelor's degree with 3+ years of experience Minimum of three (3) to four (4) years Software Development in a Product based organization Experience working in a collaborative team environment Experience with Object Oriented Programming Experience with Database Design and Implementation Understanding of n-tier Application Architecture (e.g. MVC, SOA) and Design Patterns .NET certification preferred Basic understanding of AWS Core services preferred Experience designing and implementing .Net solutions with a focus on SOA, messaging, and business rules Working knowledge of web services, service discovery protocol, messaging protocols (REST, RPC, WS-*, SOAP etc.), and schema design Experience developing solutions integrating and extending COTS products Experience with performance tuning and optimization of service-based Framework infrastructure and services Experience working with State government clients in the Medicaid systems domain preferred Excellent organizational, interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills Strong analysis, problem identification, and problem resolution capability Deadline-oriented and comfortably perform in a fast-paced environment Ability to successfully manage many complex tasks simultaneously Maximus is currently seeking a  .Net Developer to work remotely to focus on the development of  a Medicaid Provider Data Management System. 28800 Ida St Valley Nebraska 68064-8016
Why Valmont 
Welcome to Valmont, where a world of opportunity awaits. When you join our team, you become part of a passionate group dedicated to changing lives and conserving resources around the globe. We want problem solvers who roll up their sleeves to foster progress and innovation for all people. At Valmont, we provide infrastructure, irrigation, tubing and coatings to the world. We strengthen cities. We nourish croplands. We design, manufacture and coat. Our products and services make a difference. Join us, and BUILD YOUR WORLD.
A Brief Summary of This Position:
The IT Analytical Engineer is part of the IT Data & Analytics team.  This group is responsible for capturing data from numerous disparate sources of all types, modeling it & transforming it into simple information models, and working with all the various business partners within the organization to deliver actionable insights. This role will develop technical solutions and strategies for business intelligence needs; help to build and support Valmont’s self-service analytics platform; understand and work with business partners to fulfill their data and information needs; gather requirements from assigned business teams, and work with Data Engineers to build out the data models; have a deep understanding of BI tools and determine how they can be implemented to automate processes for end users within the business. 
Essential Functions:
This position reports into the Manager Enterprise Data Warehouse and has no direct or indirect reports
This role requires no travel
Flexible schedule; work in the office 1 day a week
Build and support Self-Service solutions for Business Analysts, Stakeholders, and other Business Partners
Assist in the development of Business Intelligence, Visualization, and Data Science policies and procedures as part of the Valmont Data & Analytics Center of Excellence
Develop Information marts for mining and reporting on production databases with Data Engineers, Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Data owners and Department managers
Identify research questions, problem solve using analytical tools, and communicate the results to various stakeholders
Apply Agile, Waterfall or other similar Application lifecycle methodology to develop the solutions
Ensure enterprise data warehouse solutions created under his/her responsibility adhere to departmental standards, appropriate controls and audit trails exist, and are thoroughly tested prior to installation in production environment
Provide and apply quality assurance best practices for visualization and analytical services across the organization
Develop, implement, and maintain change control and testing processes for modifications to Information Marts
Create business data dictionary for new Information Mart development and/or changes to existing ones
Determine required network components to ensure data access, as well as data consistency and integrity
Develop routines for end users to facilitate best-practice use of analytical and visualization tools
 
Required Qualifications of Every Candidate (Education, Experience, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities):
Preferred Bachelor’s Degree with 3 years relevant experience or Associate’s degree with 5 years relevant experience or 7 years of relevant experience
Three years of accumulated professional experience in the following areas:
Business intelligence and data warehouse development technologies: Microsoft Power BI, SQL Server & TSQL Procedures
Database development experience: Oracle/SQL Server
Dimensional data modeling design and implementation
Data warehouse monitoring, analysis, and performance tuning
Strong familiarity with business analytics and visualizations
Familiarity of Data Science concepts & tools
Basic understanding of Machine Learning Models and ML Ops Delivery Pipelines
Understanding of Information marts, data models, structures, theories, principles, and practices
Working technical experience with relational databases
Working knowledge of cloud based analytical tools
Good understanding of the organization’s goals and objectives
Involvement in inter-departmental projects and experience communicating with various stakeholders
Ability and desire to learn the manufacturing and business process supported by IT
Customer service mindset, and problem-solving skillset
Strong interpersonal communication and training skillsets
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
 
Highly Qualified Candidates Will Also Possess These Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Computer Science or MIS
Experience working in an Agile environment
Certifications in Tableau and/or Microsoft Power Platform.
Experience with Python or R
Working experience with Machine Learning models (regression, classification, and applied statistics/probability)
Working experience with ML Ops & Repository tools
Experience with Cloud Database Services: Microsoft Azure SQL Database, Databricks, & Synapse, Snowflake, SAP Hana Cloud
Strong history of delivering value added solutions to business users
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS)
 
Benefits:
Valmont offers employees and their families a comprehensive Total Well-being benefit package to ensure their individual and family’s overall wellness needs are met. Benefits include*:
o Medical, dental and vision insurance
o Paid time off
o Employer paid life insurance
o Employer paid short-term and long-term disability
o Retirement plans
o Dependent care
o Employee assistance programs
o Voluntary programs like tobacco cessation, Type 2 diabetes reversal, mortgage services, home & auto insurance, health coaching and more. 
Due to the nature of Valmont’s Global Business and Union contracts, not all benefits are the same.
 
Working Environment and Physical Efforts: 
Work is typically performed in an office setting.  The incumbent is regularly required to sit for extended periods of time, as well as talk and listen on the phone and in personal conversations or meetings.  Environment is fast paced and demanding most of the time.  No travel requirements for this position.  The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms while working in the office with various files and forms and while working on the computer.  The employee is occasionally required to move about the office.  Incumbent must utilize proper ergonomic safeguards such as monitor height and positions, keyboard location and height and proper wrists rests. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 15 pounds in working with large files, binders, and computer equipment.  Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, and depth perception.
Valmont does not discriminate against any employee or applicant in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by law.  Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
 If you have a disability and require any assistance in filling out the application for employment email [Email available when viewing the job]. 28800 Ida St Valley Nebraska 68064-8016

Strong history of delivering value added solutions to business users
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS)
 
Benefits:
Valmont offers employees and their families a comprehensive Total Well-being benefit package to ensure their individual and family’s overall wellness needs are met. Benefits include*:
o Medical, dental and vision insurance
o Paid time off
o Employer paid life insurance
o Employer paid short-term and long-term disability
o Retirement plans
o Dependent care
o Employee assistance programs
o Voluntary programs like tobacco cessation, Type 2 diabetes reversal, mortgage services, home & auto insurance, health coaching and more. 
Due to the nature of Valmont’s Global Business and Union contracts, not all benefits are the same.
 
Working Environment and Physical Efforts: 
Work is typically performed in an office setting.  The incumbent is regularly required to sit for extended periods of time, as well as talk and listen on the phone and in personal conversations or meetings.  Environment is fast paced and demanding most of the time.  No travel requirements for this position.  The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms while working in the office with various files and forms and while working on the computer.  The employee is occasionally required to move about the office.  Incumbent must utilize proper ergonomic safeguards such as monitor height and positions, keyboard location and height and proper wrists rests. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 15 pounds in working with large files, binders, and computer equipment.  Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, and depth perception.
Valmont does not discriminate against any employee or applicant in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by law.  Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
 If you have a disability and require any assistance in filling out the application for employment email [Email available when viewing the job].

What you'll get to do...
This is a company-critical leadership role where you lead Product Management for our Partners division, focused on delivering the products, experiences, and programs that will win hearts and minds of casual and professional web designers and developers. To succeed, you will use customer insights, market data, and competitive information to form a view of how the needs of this segment are evolving and steer our product investments to deliver best in class solutions for today and tomorrow. We believe in the scientific method to help drive our learning and innovation, leveraging test and learn methods that yield data driven decisions. In addition, you will partner with stakeholders across the company to drive outcomes that align with our strategic objectives and goals. 'In summary, you will: 
Lead the company-wide initiative to become the market leader in WordPress 
Lead our hosting business and steer it’s evolution in the context of today’s rapidly evolving technical landscape 
Develop our Pro program and efforts to help our customers growth their businesses 
Partner with other parts of Company to drive a flywheel between small businesses and the Pros who serve them 
Identify opportunities for new areas of growth and investment for these customers 
Develop, coach, and mentor a team of product leaders, product managers, channel managers, business operation and strategy managers 
Partner with Product Marketing, Finance, Customer Care, executive management, and other product leaders to create a shared vision  
Your experience should include...
10+ years experience in Product Development, including 5+ years leading Product Management teams, working with SaaS applications/Internet/software products 
Demonstrated understanding of core product management, product development, and marketing processes/methodologies such as market needs analysis, competitive analysis, product planning, marketing programs, sales programs, branding, pricing, etc.  
Intuitively translates big picture goals to micro use cases and has a strong focus on solving core problems to deliver simple solutions  
Strong track record of technical product delivery with measurable results.  
Demonstrated experience as a “builder” within an Agile environment  
3+ years experience managing a business unit P&L that involves sales, marketing and personnel related revenue and costs  
Demonstrated experience as a “whole business” thinker, including being involved in decisions trading off top and bottom line and thinking through acquisition to retention 
Fluency in SaaS economics, connecting financial outcomes with SaaS metrics. ' Demonstrated experience working at the intersection of Growth, Marketing, and Product Management  
Customer-centric orientation with excellent ability to develop insights from broad range of data and observations and translate them into meaningful product experiences 
Proven experience as a data-inspired leader, including leveraging data science and ML to more deeply understand and drive progress against goals. 
Demonstrated experience in using data driven hypothesis-based validation method for experimentation and decision making of roadmaps and strategies 
Proven experience leading or driving a significant company initiative that required shared buy-in and execution across a large set of teams  
Excellent team leadership, prioritization, communication and collaboration skills, with a high level of attention to detail, and ability to work closely with executives, engineering, design, business planning, marketing, and customer service 
Self-starter and results-oriented, able to work under minimal guidance 
Ability to work in a complex, diverse, and fast paced environment. Focus on key business goals and executing on plans with constrained resources 
Bachelor’s degree in technical field desired; MBA preferred ' 
The following characteristics define a candidate that will succeed in the culture and in this position: 
Experimentation approach and data driven: make progress through iterations  
Problem Solver: Continually resolve issues through active problem solving and striving to answer questions before they are asked. 
Strategic orientation 
Results orientation 
Business acumen, competence in running a P&L 
Collaboration and influencing 
Ownership: Accountability for products we build and the way you manage the business 
Self-Starting: A self-motivated individual who can take limited direction and produce tangible results. A resourceful individual who pro-actively thinks outside of the box. 
Curiosity: Has a naturally curious mind, loves to explore and nurture intellect; observes and identifies patterns in data that can identify actionable insights. 
Organizational Skills: The ability to bring disparate stakeholders together to resolve issues, drive consensus and prioritize workload. 
Communication: Excellent communication skills; an active listener and concise presenter. 
Judgment: Makes sound decisions in a timely manner based on the appropriate balance of data and instinct. Knows how to ask the right questions (at the right time) necessary to uncover key information that can unlock relevant action. 
Team Oriented: Works well in collaborative team environments and matrix reporting structures. What you'll get to do...

The MENTOR Network provides services for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities and medically complex needs.
Senior Talent Acquisition Recruiter Do you have experience in Talent Acquisitions and want to work for a company that positively impacts the lives of the many individuals it serves? In the TA Senior Recruiter role, you will assist the company’s commitment to serve others by recruiting and hiring employees in support of daily operations of the business unit while ensuring qualified and diverse applicant pools. 
Perform recruitment activities such as sourcing, screening resumes, interviewing candidates, etc. 
Draft employment ads and determine appropriate external websites to recruit qualified applicants 
Coordinate new hire orientation/onboarding programs, maintain confidential documents/employee files, and track applicants/corresponding documentation 
Qualifications: 
Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business, or related field 
Minimum of 5-7 years of experience 
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with an ability to quickly establish rapport with others 
Technically savvy with demonstrated knowledge of best practices with social media, applicant tracking systems, and Excel 
Strong identification with the company’s mission and values 
Ability to interpret metrics and make appropriate recommendations 
Why Join Us? 
Full compensation/benefits package for employees working 30+ hours/week 
401(k) with company match 
Paid time off and holiday pay
Complex work adding value to the organization’s mission alongside a great team of coworkers 
Enjoy job security with nationwide career development and advancement opportunities 
We have meaningful work for you – come join our team – apply today! #CSSSOUTH
The MENTOR Network is a national network of local health and human services providers offering an array of quality, community-based services. At The MENTOR Network, our core values—Integrity, Respect, Inclusion & Growth—and the behaviors that define them, guide how we interact with each other and how we approach our work. As an organization of people serving people in nearly 40 states, you’ll have opportunities from coast to coast. 
Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/vets The MENTOR Network provides services for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities and medically complex needs.

The VP, Sales Strategy will be responsible to mine and leverage data to create and drive sales strategies to contribute to driving revenue growth for Company sales team and E-suite and C-suite. Responsible for taking the data from the data team and looking at the state of the business to create strategies to grow top line revenue. They will also look at market trends and implement strategies to contribute to growth and efficiencies. The VP will provide business insight both proactively and reactively, to help leadership make decisions that will maximize revenue. This position will interact with; Marketing, Sales, Finance, I.T., and C-Level Executives.
Job Duties:
Prepare comprehensive sales models integrating financial analysis, assumptions and metrics. Analyze past results and future outcomes in conjunction with market analyses to develop recommendations.
Develop and execute sales strategies to provide value-added insights for leadership. Utilizes data mining techniques to perform various business modeling and analysis.
Develop retention strategies and programs.
Lead and manage special projects from inception to execution.
Assist in developing and delivering presentations for leadership including board, E-suite and C-suite.
Build and enhance sales models used to forecast and report the company’s revenue and other key metrics, including daily sales data and forecasts.
Develop and execute routine reporting of key performance indicators for sales initiatives.
Manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, own deliverables end to end, and collaborate with other teams within the business to achieve your goals.
Meet deadlines with the resources provided and never compromise ethical standards.
Commit to working together as one team, exceed service expectations by developing positive relationships and treat others with value and respect…always.
Exhibit an honest and committed effort to delivering as promised, never compromising quality.
Achieve individual and team goals. Meet deadlines with the resources provided and never compromise ethical standards.
Seek opportunities for personal and professional development. Attend all company required training and actively participate in development conversations with managers.
Contribute to the overall growth and success of Company by embracing the Company core values:
We are One Company.
We are accountable.
We get the job done right.
We empower others.
Minimum Qualifications:  
Bachelor’s degree in Business Management, Marketing or related field.
10+ years in Sales within Direct Sales and at a proficient level.
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s degree in Business Management, Marketing or related field.
Network Marketing Industry. Sales Strategies.

Job Description:
Design Program Manager
Bank of America Experience Design At Bank of America, we’re guided by a common purpose: to help make financial lives better by connecting clients and communities to the resources they need to be successful. Bank of America’s Experience Design team includes interaction designers, graphic designers, researchers, strategic designers, design program managers, content strategists, design technologists and other creative professionals. The team is constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to find ways all our digital platforms can empower customers to reach their financial goals in more customized, intuitive, innovative, engaging, secure, and time-saving ways. We are seeking an experienced Design Program Manager to execute operational and process strategies to ensure the Experience Design (XD) organization provides the highest possible value. As a design program manager, you will
Be a strong and resourceful workflow and team manager who actively drives results
Support cross functional design portfolios delivering the highest efficiency through all project interactions
Facilitate scope definition and prioritization with Design Directors, Associate Directors and partners
Ensure XD is meeting partner expectations by focusing on high quality execution of scoped work
Collaborate with Digital Design & Delivery leaders and partner organizations to optimize resource deployment across the entire portfolio
Produce regular portfolio status and analytics reporting
Facilitate continuous E2E process improvement and streamlining of routines to allow greater productivity and integration of the XD team across the enterprise
Aggressively and seek out any and all issues blocking the XD organization from providing the highest possible value. Proactively collaborates across all organizations to find creative solutions.
 
You’re a person who has (required skills):
5+ years of project/process management or business experience.
Strong process knowledge including User-Centered Design, Design Sprints, Agile and other process methodologies used in the digital environment.
Experience with Atlassion tools such as Jira and Confluence
Knowledge of and practice at multi-channel industry standards and best practices.
Strong verbal and written communicator.
Working knowledge of software used by designers.
 
And you are a person who:
Makes stuff happen: Uses defined and ad hoc processes to get the job done. Proactively inspects, detects, and juggles to find the best way to make things happen. Provides real leadership and acts as the hub of knowledge and source of truth for initiatives. Influences people, anticipates and resolves issues, sees the big picture.
Brings teams together: Inspires individuals and teams to recognize the value of getting things done. Nudges, leads, empowers, facilitates, and communicates to get teams to make things happen.
Solves problems: Leverages broad digital knowledge to identify and drive solutions. Understands overall strategy, execution tactics, business drivers, technical capabilities, and more to effectively engage cross-organization teams.
Navigates: Great communicators and networkers who can drive conversations with all teams engaged in the digital space. Speaks the languages of design, business, and technology to drive progress through respect and understanding.
Organized juggler: Works on multiple initiatives at one time, using strong communication skills to manage time and expectations appropriately with a demonstrated ability to think strategically about the overall experience. Advocates for smart application of process to get highest quality work at the fastest pace.
Learns and adapts: Keep pace with the ever-changing digital environment iterating designs through Lean XD, Agile, and other modern design/build processes.
 
You’ll be better prepared if you have (desired skills):
Master’s degree, PMP certification or commensurate work experience
Financial or similar industry experience
 We’re a culture that
Is committed to building a workplace where every employee is welcomed and given the support and resources to build and advance their careers.  Along with taking care of our clients we want to be a great place for people to work, and we strive to create an environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve their goals.
Believes diversity makes us stronger so we can reflect, connect to and meet the diverse needs of our clients around the world.
Provides continuous training and developmental opportunities to help employees achieve their goals, whatever their background or experience.
Is committed to advancing our tools, technology and ways of working.  We always put our clients first to meet their evolving needs.
Believes in responsible growth and is dedicated to supporting communities around the world by connecting them to the lending, investing and giving they need to remain vibrant and vital.
 
Job Band:
H5
Shift: 
1st shift (United States of America)
Hours Per Week:
40
Weekly Schedule:

**Only U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. can be considered as W2 candidates.**
Job Title: Fabrication Operator
Location: Broken Arrow, Oklahoma, USA 74012
Duration: 6 Months, potential to go permanent
Schedule: 6:00am - 3:30pm 
Description:
Follow blueprints, drawings, and written or verbal instructions. Lay out, measure, and mark dimensions and reference lines on material, according to drawings or templates, using calculators, scribes, dividers, squares, and rulers. Maneuver completed units into position for punch. Select gauges and types of metal or non-metallic material, according to product specifications. 
The Fabrication worker will have the responsibility to run multiple activities related to the transformation processes of sheet metal and copper in a Switchgear and transfer switches manufacturing environment. 
She/he will be accountable to learn and operate different machines utilized within the fabrication area: Punch, press brake, paint line, plating line, powder coating, among others. Activities are monitored and assigned by Fabrication lead. Assignation of machines will be based on business necessities and candidate’s performance. 
The fabrication worker will review product/part specifications (drawing and/or program) to run pre-assigned process/machine (punch, shear, press, paint line) 
The Fabrication worker will be part of a multi-functional production team focused on Switchgear and transfer switches manufacturing, reporting directly to the fabrication lead.
Vaccination Notice 
This position requires Contingent Workers to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless they are granted a medical or religious exemption. **Only U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. can be considered as W2 candidates.**

At Allied Universal®, we continue to build an inclusive, Be Phenomenal® culture that encourages, supports, and celebrates a diverse workplace. It fuels our innovation and connects us closer to our customers and the communities in which we serve. Allied Universal offers so much more than just a job. We offer careers. We take great pride in our promote-from-within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. We offer medical, dental and vision coverage, life insurance, 401K, employee assistance programs, company discounts, perks and more for all full-time positions! Start your phenomenal career with Allied Universal® today!
Allied Universal has security jobs and are seeking to fill the position of Professional Security Officer. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental and vision coverage, life insurance, 401K, sick pay (in states where required), employee assistance programs, company discounts, perks and more! We also offer part-time and flexible schedules!
As a Professional Security Officer for Allied Universal you will be responsible for the security and safety of our client’s property and personnel. As the Allied Universal Security Officer, you will know all site-specific policies and procedures, and implement emergency response activities as appropriate, while providing superior customer service.
QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:
Be at least 18 years of age 
Possess a high school diploma or equivalent, or 5 years verifiable experience
Possess effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel and the general public in a professional and effective manner
Licensing requirements are subject to state and/or local laws and regulations and may be required prior to employment.
As a condition of employment, employee must successfully complete a background investigation and a drug screen in accordance with all federal, state, and local laws
Driving Positions: must possess a valid Driver’s License with at least one year of driving experience, a clean driving record (no major violations within last 36 months, no more than 1 accident in last 24 months, no more than one minor moving violation in last 24 months), a minimum level of insurance as required by Company policy, and the ability to safely operate a vehicle required.
Display exceptional customer service and communication skills
Have intermediate computer skills to operate innovative, wireless technology at client specific sites
Ability to handle crisis situations at the client site, calmly and efficiently
Able to:
Work in various environments such as cold weather, rain/snow or heat
Occasionally lift or carry up to 40 pounds
Climb stairs, ramps, or ladders occasionally during shift
Stand or walk on various surfaces for long periods of time
Allied Universal® provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to people and businesses within our local communities, and is North America’s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information: [Link available when viewing the job].
We proudly support the Veteran Jobs Mission, a group of over 200 companies that have committed to collectively hiring a total of one million military veterans. ESSENTIAL FUNCTION:Reporting to the Manager of the Software Engineering Department, the UI Software Engineer’s primary responsibility is to contribute to the development of the client’s next generation 3D scanning software applications using innovative UI and intelligent application development to make the scanning of patient’s teeth more intuitive and effortless.  In this role, the UI Software Engineering will use the latest tools and standards to develop high-performance, cross-platform graphical applications. They will be expected to work within an experienced scrum-based software development team to develop high-quality code quickly and efficiently to meet specified requirement.  KEY AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY:
Design simple to use solution to challenging problems
Become familiar with the client’s scanning application workflows
Work together with development team and product owners to implement and integrate new features
Manage and manipulate graphical assets as needed to meet specified requirements 
Develop high-quality code that adheres to the client’s coding standards
Continually expand your problem solving and software design capabilities 
Participate in all scrum team activities
Participate in requirement, UI design, and code reviews
Implement features in a well-documented, consistent, and reliable manner
EDUCATION & QUALIFICATIONS: 
BS degree in Computer Science or similar engineering discipline
Minor or coursework in 3D computer graphics, computer simulation, AR/VR, or gaming (preferred)
3+ years of experience programming in C# 
1+ years of UI development experience (Unity UI preferred)
1+ years of Unity development experience
Strong attention to detail
Experience in a software developer role using Agile methodologies (Preferred)
Working knowledge of Microsoft Visual Studio, Jira, and Git version control system 
Experience with image manipulation tools such-as Photoshop and GIMP
Excellent organizational, oral, and writing skills (English)
Tenacious Creativity and Innovation: Not accepting of the status quo
Great Attitude: A great sense of humor, strong commitment, flexibility (ability to respond quickly to changing workloads and priorities), and humble (ability to leave your ego at the door).

job_title: Internal Cyber Risk and Data Protection Controls Compliance and Operational Risk Manager
job_text:
Job Description:
The Compliance and Operational Risk (C&OR) Manager is responsible for engaging in activities to provide independent compliance and operational risk oversight of Front Line Unit or Control Function (“FLU/CF”) performance and any related third party/vendor relationships in alignment with the Global Compliance - Enterprise Policy, the Operational Risk Management - Enterprise Policy (collectively “the Policies”) and the Compliance and Operational Risk Management (“CORM”) Program and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). As a member of an FLU or CF C&OR officer team, the C&OR Manager is accountable for proactive identification, management and escalation of compliance and operational risks through the execution of some or all of the below identified activities. This role exercises judgment and influence, and may constructively challenge FLU and CF leaders to support the CORM Program objectives, balancing business strategy with appropriate controls.The C&OR Manager proactively engages with other C&OR officers, including horizontal coverage owners and Enterprise Areas of Coverage (“EAC”), to provide comprehensive oversight of FLU/CF activities. This role develops and maintains a global coverage plan which defines the scope and risk-based focus of the second line’s risk management activities. The C&OR Manager prepares materials for C&OR regulatory exams/audits/inquiries and may provide consultation to business leaders in preparation for FLU/CF regulatory exams/audits/inquiries.The C&OR Manager plans, drives and reviews team deliverables to support consistent quality of activities, processes and outputs. This role may contribute as a manager responsible for providing leadership direction to attract, assess, develop, motivate and retain a team, or may act as an individual contributor.The C&OR Manager contributes to the requirements of the CORM Program requirements including, but not limited to the following activities:• Produces and/or oversees the development of independent risk management reporting for respective area(s) of coverage as input governance and management routines• Provides subject matter expertise to assist the FLU/CF in establishing an annual learning plan, may be accountable for developing and delivering training content• Develops and maintains C&OR-owned policies and standards and/or provides oversight of FLU/CF-owned policies, standards and procedures to ensure regulatory and operational risk requirements are appropriately addressed, inclusive of conduct risk as applicable• Monitors the regulatory environment to identify regulatory changes applicable to area(s) of coverage, advises business leaders on those changes, directs the appropriate areas to implement or amend policies, standards, procedures and/or processes to address regulatory requirements, and challenges the implementation plan as needed; maintains a comprehensive regulatory inventory• Identifies, aggregates, reports, escalates, inspects and challenges remediation plans, and performs thematic analysis on FLU/CF-owned issues and control enhancements• Ensures C&OR “owned” issues and control enhancements are identified and addressed appropriately and timely• Contributes to or leads development of risk coverage plans, executes and / or oversees execution of independent risk monitoring, testing and risk assessments, communicates results• Reviews and challenges the FLU/CF process, risk, control (PRC) inventory and FLU/CF Risk & Control Self-Assessment (RCSA)• Reviews and challenges internal and external operational loss events, including development of remediation plans to strengthen controls, and approves where appropriate• Participates in Scenario Analysis activities for coverage areas and challenges as appropriate• Ensures metrics are designed to measure key risks and control performance, monitors and reports on metric performance and breach remediation
Required Skills: Minimum Years of Business & Functional Experience: 7 YearsDegree Required: Bachelor’s Degree; May require regulatory examination/registration or certification depending on jurisdiction and role The Compliance and Operational Risk (C&OR) Manager is responsible for engaging in activities to provide independent compliance and operational risk oversight of Front Line Unit or Control Function (FLU/CF) performance and any related third party/vendor relationships in alignment with the Global Compliance - Enterprise Policy, the Operational Risk Management - Enterprise Policy (collectively the Policies) and the Compliance and Operational Risk Management (CORM) Program and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). As a member of an FLU or CF C&OR officer team, the C&OR Manager is accountable for proactive identification, management and escalation of compliance and operational risks through the execution of some or all of the below identified activities. This role exercises judgment and influence, and may constructively challenge FLU and CF leaders to support the CORM Program objectives, balancing business strategy with appropriate controls.
Desired Skills: Financial Services or similarly regulated sector
Systems Access ThreatsData Security ControlsData Loss PreventionEnterprise/Business Information Security 
Job Band:
H4
Shift: 
1st shift (United States of America)
Hours Per Week:
40
Weekly Schedule:
Referral Bonus Amount:
0 -->

Position Overview:
Works as a team member with dietary personnel and dietitians in the daily production requirements for patient room service requests and Lobby Grille production needs. Prepares meats, fish, fowl, vegetables, gravies, soups, sauces, and baked goods according to standardized recipes. Makes changes in diets as required by dietary orders. Assembles patient nourishment. Assists patients in food choices as recommended by physician and/or dietitian. Demonstrates ability to offer guidelines for the physician prescribed diets. Assists in delivery and communication of foodstuffs to patients. Assures product quality, observes food service safety standards for proper food storage, handling, cooking/serving temperatures,
and the minimization of food waste. Reports to the Food Service Director. The essential functions include but are not limited to the list that follows. This department will do whatever it takes to have a 5-star customer service program.
Essential Functions:
Prepares foodstuffs for patients and cafeteria meals with standards of quality as specified by the Colorado Department of Health and JCAHO standards for all basic food handling guidelines as specified by local, state and federal health agencies. Proper preparation of foodstuffs as ordered by physician, dietitian, captain and/or room service personnel paying specific attention to items such as portion control, high calories, low protein, etc., dietary needs.
Physical Demands and Working Conditions:
a) Physical Demand Characteristics:
\u00b7 In an 8 or 12-hour workday, this position must be able to stand or walk for 8 to 12 hours constantly. 
\u00b7 The position requires continuous squatting, bending, kneeling, reaching, twisting, stair climbing, and exposure to changes of temperature or humidity; frequent exposure to dust, fumes or gases; and occasional crawling, ladder climbing, walking on rough, being near moving machinery, and working from heights. Employees in this position must be able to lift up to 50-100 pounds 1-33% of the workday.
\u00b7 Employees in this position must be able to carry up to 51-74 pounds frequently. This position requires that the employee push and/or pull up to 51-74 pounds frequently. Both feet are needed. 
b) Equipment Used: Knives, Steamtable, Slicer, Toaster, Ovens, Steamer, Food Processor, Blender, Dishwasher, Other cooking or food preparation equipment.
c) Visual Hearing and Dexterity Demands: Organizes and coordinates activities, requires visual attention and eye/hand coordination for doing motor skill functions.
d) Working Conditions: Works indoors in a clean, well-lit temperature controlled and ventilated area.
Qualifications & Skills: 
a) Education: High School diploma or equivalent. Education in food service cooking in a formal institutional food service operation or restaurant desired.
b) Training & Experience: One-year experience or equivalent in institutional cooking, preferably in a health care setting.
c) Job Knowledge: Required to demonstrate knowledge and ability to perform institutional food service cooking measured by the Health Care Food Service Training Manual and competency tests. Required to demonstrate full knowledge of therapeutic diets. Ability to communicate in a highly effective manner as measured by the Health Care Food Service Training Manual and competency tests. Food handling/safety course desired but not mandatory at time of employment. Ability to demonstrate professional phone etiquette and professional interactions with patients, staff and visitors. Knowledge of therapeutic diets desired. Position Overview:

WHO WE ARE: Lev, a Cognizant company, is a premier digital consultancy that works with marketers from top brands to maximize their investments in Salesforce, level up their customer experiences, and power even the most complicated of businesses.  As a top Salesforce partner, we take pride in hiring and developing the best of the best, and we work hard to cultivate an inclusive culture (#LevLife) where our team (also known as Levsters) will thrive.  While we celebrate each other’s individuality, we are brought together by our commitment to provide unparalleled expertise and an out-of-this-world experience to our customers; our drive to shape the future of marketing and the future of Salesforce; and our desire to do right by one another. We are relentless in our pursuit of being the best of the best, and driving marketing success with Salesforce. Since 2016, Lev has experienced tremendous growth. We joined the Cognizant family in March 2020, further cementing our position as a global leader in Salesforce consulting. We continue to excel as a high-growth company through expanding the ways we serve our customers, and by growing our global footprint. Lev is headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana, with remote employees across the United States and United Kingdom.  This position is available for Remote Candidates across the United States.  WHO YOU ARE: As a Manager, Salesforce Solution Architects at Lev, you will work on projects with a variety of clients at one time while supporting a team of Salesforce Solution Architects.  As a Manager, Solution Architects you will work with clients in order to understand their needs while collaborating with other Levsters to build out the technical solution. You will participate in solution design and focus on hands-on build work.  You are an experienced consultant with a vast knowledge of Salesforce’s core platform, and are depended on by our customers for technical vision and proactive and strategic advice. You are also passionate about helping your team develop their skills and take on new challenges, while also helping them work through client solutions and troubleshooting.  WHAT YOU’LL DO:  + Manage a team of 3-7 solution architects with varying degrees of experience. This is a critical role that is tasked with the health, happiness and effectiveness of their team. + Provide career guidance, helping employees to identify and work towards career goals. + Set and manage performance expectations with the team. + Conduct one on one meetings with your team members + Assist your team members with any technical or communication challenges on their projects + Attend leadership meetings to learn about new ways to support your team and to contribute to strategic initiatives  + Onboard and train new team members. Managers carry a billable workload as well, performing the same duties as a Senior Salesforce Solution Architect: + Act as a key member of the Salesforce implementation project team and be responsible for the overall design of the application and mapping client business requirements to systems and technical requirements. + Work as a team member along with the Project Manager, Technical Architect and supporting team members to deliver the complete solution for the customer. + Participate in process flow analysis and process redesign along with the Project Manager. + Share best practices and be consultative to clients throughout the duration of the project. + Produce a detailed functional design document to match customer requirements. + Complete and co-implement a configuration workbook. + Collaborate with the Technical Architect to produce a technical specification for custom development and systems integration requirements. + Provide current best practice and third party solution alternatives as part of the functional design document. + Lead the UAT efforts. + Participate in training design, documentation and delivery efforts in concert with the Project Manager. + Participate and lead, when needed, project meetings with the customer. + Average of 10% travel, up to 25%, to client locations throughout the U.S. + Perform other duties required and assigned.  EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE: Required + 5+ years of Salesforce configurations + Past experience creating technical solutions across a majority of applicable languages (such as SQL, HTML, CSS, Javascript, Apex, etc) + History of designing and delivering a training program tailored to clients' needs + Experience mentoring individuals in an equal or lesser role + Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience + Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future. Preferred + 3+ years experience with enterprise integration tools and extract, transformation and load (ETL) tools. + Experience with SDLC and Agile (Scrum) project methodologies. + Background in consulting in large enterprises. + SFDC Certification (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, DEV, or other SFDC certification also acceptable).  Cognizant will not sponsor H-1B or other U.S. work authorization, or lawful permanent residence (otherwise known as a “Green Card”) for this role.   
Employee Status : Full Time Employee
Shift : Day Job
Job Posting : Sep 30 2021

Job Description
Join our growing team! Be involved in the analysis, design, development and deployment of consistent training materials to support Sales and Marketing at Hilton Grand Vacations. This unique opportunity allows you to work with the Director of eLearning and positively impact the performance of the organization! As the Instructional Designer in Sales and Marketing you will successfully execute the following:  Utilize the latest Instructional Systems Design techniques to build groundbreaking learning solutions for HGV Sales and Marketing teams Serve as a key partner in the creation of creative and engaging learning solutions to include instructor led training, eLearning, job aids, and other relevant training materials Write learning objectives, course content, scenarios, media scripts, practice activities, and assessments Create and maintain eLearning courses and online tests using Articulate Storyline and other development tools Create sales training manuals, product knowledge guides, technology training guides, and other printed training resources using Adobe InDesign, MS Word, and MS PowerPoint Assist with all areas of testing, course evaluations, analysis, feedback collection, and updating the training  Partner with the Senior Manager of LMS to administer courses, course assignments, and reporting in the learning management system (LMS) Collaborate across all departments within HGV to ensure training content is current, accurate, consistent and aligned with goals Assist with the development and implementation of training benchmarks for continuous improvement with training programs Openly engage in all discussions relating to training issues; provide solution-based input and make logical recommendations. Deliver projects efficiently so that tasks are completed on time and problems are anticipated or resolved quickly  
Qualifications
Hilton Grand Vacations is a leader in the vacation ownership industry, operating with an unwavering dedication to innovation, quality, and continued growth. At the core of our company’s success are our Team Members. To fulfill this role successfully, you must possess the following minimum qualifications and experience:  Bachelor's Degree 2+ years in a corporate learning and development position 2+ years personally crafting and developing training materials such as training guides, and job aids 2 or more years of experience creating eLearning modules using eLearning development tools 2+ years of experience with learning management system administration functions Expert technical writing, proofreading and grammar skills Strong relationship building and collaboration skills  It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions:  Master's Degree Video editing experience Facilitation experience Experience working in a sales industry   We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. Job Description

Job Description:
Looking for an opportunity to make an impact?
At Leidos, we deliver innovative solutions through the efforts of our diverse and talented people who are dedicated to our customers’ success. We empower our teams, contribute to our communities, and operate sustainable. Everything we do is built on a commitment to do the right thing for our customers, our people, and our community. Our Mission, Vision, and Values guide the way we do business. Your greatest work is ahead!
The Leidos Research Support Team supporting the National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL) is seeking a Computational Geo-Scientist to join our Team in Albany, OR  as part of our Workforce Development Program. This opportunity will allow side-by-side execution of research with world-class scientists and engineers using state of the art equipment to contribute to new areas of basic and applied research.  
The employee will leverage their data science capabilities to participate in research that focuses on developing tools and managing data that provide critical insights to support the priorities of the DOE Fossil Energy and Carbon Management mission space.   
TERM OF COMMITMENT: This research position is intended to be a term position, with varying levels of commitment that are not expected to last longer than 1 year. You will be informed prior to applying what length of commitment is anticipated. Also, those who successfully fill a term position, may be invited to apply for an additional term. Nothing in this paragraph is intended to create an employment contract. Employment will remain at will. 
If this sounds like the kind of environment where you can thrive, keep reading!
Primary Responsibilities Include:
Building and modifying software tools using Python, writing customized, standalone scripts, developing new applications  
Maintaining software and applications 
Data collection, aggregation, processing, and interpretation of experimental and field-based geochemical, geophysical, and remote sensing data using statistical, numerical, graphical, GIS and quantitative tools 
Collaborating with interdisciplinary team, including geologists and other science researchers to assist each other in accomplishing project-related tasks 
Building relationships with internal and external clients 
Creating and delivers oral and poster presentations of results 
Required Qualifications:
Currently enrolled in a Masters Degree program or recent graduate in data science, computer science, math, geology, geography, geo-statistics, geospatial science, environmental science, or similar field with less than 2 years of prior relevant experience
Proficient in Python
Familiarity with RSoftware and technical proficiencies in GIS (ArcGIS suite), database management (PostgreSQL), and remote sensing
Demonstrable skills in the application of various artificial intelligence/machine learning methods for analyses and software development  
Willingness and interest in learning geological information related to data (i.e. offshore subsurface topics and spatial data) 
Preferred Qualifications:
Familiarity with C, C++, SQL data libraries and source code repositories 
Familiarity with JavaScript, HTML, PHP, CSS
Course work in spatial analysis, spatial statistics, spatial modeling, web programming, spatial databases, programming and scripting for GIS, digital image processing and analysis, GIS program management, geological applications of remote sensing, and geologic field mapping methods
Pay Range: Description

Why This Opportunity?
As a Project Designer or Job Captain, what could be better than working for a firm with high-visibility projects that make a difference locally, and nationally. Our clients focus on some of the most forward thinking buildings spanning across Commercial, Multi-Family, Mixed-Use Developments, Hospitality, and Tech/Campus work.
The training and support is world-class, meaning if you have the passion and desire, you can be highly successful in this role, and have a VERY prosperous career.
With the high visisbility of projects our client works on, what could be better than having a project worked on, be viewed by over 1 Billion spectators? Apply now....
What Qualifacations Are Required?
Bachelor Degree from an Accredited School or Equivalent
5-12 Years of Experience Post Graduation
*Revit*, SKetchUP, 3D Modeling Skills
Abillity to provide never before seen designs, and next generation designs.
Excellent communication skills
Proven ability to work collaboratively and with members of cross-functional teams
Fluency in working with clients and illustrating design ideas
What Can You Expect to Be Doing?
Work with clients, the production team, and outside consultants to craft and complete designs
Develop design concepts for various client needs and building types
Perform document production by developing design and technical drawings. Conduct code and product research.
Follow up with project teams and ensure design accuracy is maintained
Work alongside senior staff to evaluate individual project needs and coordinate with consultants
Demonstrate motivation in seeking new responsibilities and challenges
Review drawings, ensure accurate document preparation

Position: Registered Nurse RN Medical-Surgical - Per Diem / Flexible Shifts
CareRev is the future of work in healthcare. With our mobile app, you’re just a few clicks away from creating an ideal work schedule that fits your life and pays the bills. CareRev is proud to pay the highest rates in the industry not once, but twice a week via direct deposit.
Signing up is simple. Once you’ve applied, passed your interview, and completed registration, you’ll be ready to book shifts, work, and get paid. It’s that easy!  
‍
Requirements for Medical-Surgical RN Role
Minimum one-year full-time inpatient Med/Surg RN experience, including critical care. Must be current and within the past year. This doesn’t include school and clinicals. Home health care and corrections facility experience are not applicable for this position..
Los Angeles Fire Card & Managing Assaultive Behaviors Certification Preferred
All-around skills including familiarity with a wide set of medical and surgical problems, multitasking across patients, effective planning, and the ability to collaborate with providers to manage all aspects of patients' daily care.
Please note you will be asked about your COVID vaccine status at the time of your interview. Vaccine guidelines vary between facility partners and geographic regions.
‍
How to Apply
Click "Apply Now" on this job posting.
Check your email. A CareRev Talent Manager will reach with the next steps.
Don’t see an update? Check your spam. We don’t want you to miss booking your interview!

Now is your chance to lead a cohesive team of high functioning, dedicated senior living professionals at the premier senior living community in the Twin Cities!   
Essential Job Functions Duties and Responsibilities
  Provide an environment for residents that foster positive customer outcomes. Assist with planning, organizing and implementing services, programs and activities, in accordance with all current rules and regulations that apply to Assisted Living Facilities. Participate in the development, maintenance and updating of policies and procedures, job descriptions, in-services and resident care forms for the community. Provide direction and supervision to all staff and support them as needed. Provide written and oral reports to the Regional Director regarding facility performance. Property inspections which includes walk through of communities and grounds with results documented in a written report. Enhance employee and resident relations with the goal of improving survey scores in each area. Assist with vendor issues to insure quality and the best pricing for all communities. Assist in preparation for state surveys and follow up of surveys working closely with the Regional Director for this area. Attend and participate in continuing education programs designed for, and related to this position. Liaison with Regional staff to insure company compliance at all levels. Represent the facility and its' mission to the residents and staff of the communities and adhere to policies and procedures at all times. Assist with crisis management in the event of an emergency in one of the communities. Review and resolve on all grievances and complaints made by the residents.  
Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
  Must possess the ability to make independent decisions and follow instructions.  Must be able to deal tactfully with personnel, residents, family members, visitors, government agencies/personnel, and the general public.  Must be able to work with ill, disabled and elderly people within the facility. Must be able to speak and write English in an understandable manner.   
Education and Experience
  A high school diploma or GED. 2 years experience in health care management.  
Licensing/Certifications
  Must possess or be able to possess a license if required in this state. Now is your chance to lead a cohesive team of high functioning, dedicated senior living professionals at the premier senior living community in the Twin Cities!

Purpose of the Position: The Manager of Credit Policy will play a key role in managing credit policy in the company’s consumer lending underwriting and portfolio management. The position will report to the VP of Credit and closely work with various business partners in analytics, modeling, marketing, product development, and legal/compliance.Required Education and Experience:• Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field such as Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Engineering, Computer Science is required.• Advanced degree (i.e., MBA or MS, Ph.D. in a related field) is preferred but not required• 4+ years of experience in consumer lending credit risk management or other related areas in financial services industry.• Experience in sub-prime lending is a plus.Skills and Abilities:• Strong analytical discipline, a solution-oriented mindset, and a strong focus on outcomes.• Deep curiosity and an innovative spirit through company-wide collaboration, industry practices, and disruptive thinking.• Clear, effective written and oral communication skills.• Ability to work in a dynamic and cross-functional environment, to interact with and influence senior leaders, partners in risk management, global servicing network, compliance, and legal.• Team player mentality with a track record of building relationships and collaborating with cross-functional business partners.• Hands-on experience in risk management in consumer lending, especially in subprime lending.• Knowledge of lead generation market and Ping Tree system.• Ability to handle large datasets using a database query language (e.g., SQL), R, Python, or another similar programming language.• Strong problem-solving, decision-making, and analytical abilities.• Experience with BI tool (Tableau or PowerBI) is preferred.• Close attention to detail with the ability to multitask, adapt to changing priorities, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.• Proven written and verbal technical communication skills applicable to diversely specialized stakeholders at all levels of a finance organization.
PandoLogic. ACS Solutions has an immediate need for a "Lockbox Clerk" with experience in the Banking Industry. This is a 6-months Temp opportunity
Position Title:: "Lockbox Clerk" 
Duration:: 6 Months Assignment 
Locations:: 1501 N Plano Rd. Richardson Texas 75081 United States"
Job Description :
Responsible for performing daily office tasks such as filing, recording, maintaining records, copying, posting, and other similar duties, using a computer terminal, typewriter, and other word processors. Follows organization and department procedures to complete tasks in a timely manner. Requires a high school diploma or its equivalent with at least 3-5 years of experience in the field or in a related area. Familiar with a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures. Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of complicated tasks. May direct and lead the work of others. Typically reports to a manager or head of a unit/department. 
MUST BE FULLY VACCINATE
ABOUT ACS Solutions.
ACS Solutions is a global provider of information technology solutions, talent solutions and workforce management services. Our Industry vertical based domain expertise, passion for innovation, combined with the power of technologies in cognitive sciences, cloud computing, data sciences, product engineering, robotic process automation, machine learning, and block chain, helps clients envision, build and run their businesses more efficiently. Headquartered in the US, ACS Solutions has grown to over $1.2 BN.
ACS Solutions is a Certified MBE by the Georgia National Minority Supplier Development Council.
ACS solutions has multiple subsidiaries, each focused on the unique area of business:
Analysts international Corporation (Staff Augmentation Services)
The Ascent Services Group Inc. (Life Sciences Talent Solutions)
HireGenics, (Payrolling, IC Compliance, & MSP Services)
DATA Inc. (Information Technology- staffing)

Largest Minority IT Staffing Firm in the US. (SIA 2019)
ClearlyRated® 2020 Best of Staffing award winner for providing remarkable service quality to our clients. This is our ninth consecutive win.
IT and Industry certifications:
Microsoft Gold Partner: Application Development, Cloud Platform, Data Analytics, Data Center, DevOps, Data Platform
AWS Managed Services Partner
Google Cloud Partner
ISO 27001:2013 Certified for Data Security

Position Title:: "Lockbox Clerk" 
Duration:: 6 Months Assignment 
Locations:: 1501 N Plano Rd. Richardson Texas 75081 United States"
Job Description :
Responsible for performing daily office tasks such as filing, recording, maintaining records, copying, posting, and other similar duties, using a computer terminal, typewriter, and other word processors. Follows organization and department procedures to complete tasks in a timely manner. Requires a high school diploma or its equivalent with at least 3-5 years of experience in the field or in a related area. Familiar with a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures. Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of complicated tasks. May direct and lead the work of others. Typically reports to a manager or head of a unit/department. 
MUST BE FULLY VACCINATE

All 1,000 of our Marshalls stores embrace discovery, from designer luggage to statement shoes. Our assortment of brands is always changing, but our mission to provide the surprises that make the everyday a little more fun is unwavering. Just like working here. Everyone encourages each other and embraces the excitement that can come with change. Each shift is a new opportunity to Discover Different.
Posting Notes: Marshalls Store 0141 || 1200 Clearview Pkwy Suite 1250 || New Orleans || LA || 70123
 Job Summary:   
 Responsible for delivering a highly satisfied customer experience demonstrated by engaging and interacting with all customers, embodying customer experience principals and philosophy, and maintaining a clean and organized store environment. Adheres to all operational, merchandise, and loss prevention standards. May be cross-trained to work in multiple areas of the store in order to support the needs of the business. 
 Responsibilities: 
  Role models established customer experience practices with internal and external customers   Supports and embodies a positive store culture through honesty, integrity, and respect   Accurately rings customer purchases/returns and counts change back to customer according to established operating procedures   Promotes credit and loyalty programs during customer interactions   Maintains and upholds merchandising philosophy and follows established merchandising procedures and standards   Accurately processes and prepares merchandise for the sales floor following company procedures and standards   Initiates and participates in store recovery as needed throughout the day   Maintains all organizational, cleanliness, and recovery standards for the sales floor and participates in the maintenance/cleanliness of the entire store   Provides and accepts ongoing recognition and constructive feedback   Adheres to all labor laws, policies, and procedures   Supports and participates in store shrink reduction goals and programs   Participates in safety awareness and maintenance of a risk-free environment   Performs other duties as assigned  
 Requirements: 
  Possesses excellent customer service skills   Able to work a flexible schedule to support business needs   Possesses strong organizational skills with attention to detail   Capable of handling multiple tasks at one time   Able to respond appropriately to changes in direction or unexpected situations   Possesses strong communication skills   Capable of lifting heavy objects with or without reasonable accommodation   Works effectively with peers and supervisors to accomplish tasks   Retail customer experience preferred  
We’re reinventing retail and helping people discover that next find that’s going to be their new signature look. You can be a part of their journey to look amazing.Our inventory is always changing and our approach is continually evolving, which means every day is another chance to Discover Different. In fact, that’s what it’s like throughout the entire TJX family, which includes TJ Maxx, HomeGoods, Sierra, and Homesense.
Discover Different also means we embrace each other’s differences and unique perspectives. We consider all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, gender identity and expression, marital or military status. We also provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act and applicable state and local law.
