The Director – Data Steward / Governance manages a team of business Data Scientists responsible for establishing standards, improving data quality and ensuring that Michael’s analytics team has the necessary data and tools to allow incremental and transformational performance across the organization.This role is positioned to support teams across the entire organization and ensures team members have the technology capabilities required to conduct modeling, SQL-based querying, and advanced dashboarding with automation where applicable.
Major Activities
Data Stewardship:
Drive the evolution of the Customer Data Platform to continue to broaden the landscape of analytics capabilities for Michaels
Responsible for ensuring data availability, accuracy, and fidelity are behind all data platforms, including the Customer Data Platform, for Michaels team member use
Establish a knowledge repository for our analysts to share best practices and build capabilities
Act as point of escalation when unexpected issues and/or new requirements are surfaced, and guide those issues to resolution
Evaluate data quality and establish a data quality score for key metrics
Conduct cross organizational training as required
Ensure Michaels’ teams have the best tools/resources available and proactively evaluate opportunities for new and different approaches to company challenges
Cross-Team Collaboration:
Act as the key contact and business owner to our CDP vendor and other customer data vendors
Partner with IT to enable accurate and reliable data analytics across multiple platforms
Evaluate, plan, and execute analytics projects as-needed to serve leaders across the organization (including marketing, merchandising, store operations and others)
Present data and insights to business leaders in a clear and concise manner
Team Leadership:
Hire, retain, and develop outstanding and diverse staff through ownership of our data science hiring processes, brand, and functional leadership of data scientists
Lead and develop a team of data scientists. Invest in your team’s skills, tools, and processes to improve their velocity
Other duties as assigned
Minimum Education
Bachelor’s Degree in quantitative field, Master’s preferred
Minimum Special Certifications or Technical Skills
Fluent in data fundamentals: SQL, data manipulation using a procedural language (R, Python), statistics, experimentation, and modeling
Minimum Type of Experience the Job Requires
A minimum of 5-10 years of relevant work experience in data science for a consumer product or retail company
3+ years of experience managing data scientists
Proven experience partnering with executive staff on data topics
Professional experience as a data science leader, setting the vision for how to most effectively use data in your organization.
Other
Excellent written and verbal communication skills on quantitative topics for a variety of audiences: product managers, designers, engineers, and business leaders
Proven track record of using data to provide actionable business results
Applicants in the U.S. and Canada must satisfy federal, state, provincial and local legal requirements of the job. Support Center - Irving

Michaels is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are here for all Team Members and all Makers to create, innovate and be better together. 
 To review a comprehensive list of benefits, please visit  [Link available when viewing the job] CT and CO only -To review pay ranges for the position you are applying for, please visit [Link available when viewing the job]In this role you will work closely with both the Michaels leadership team in driving projects associated with multiple large-scale transformation efforts underway across the company. The Product Manager I develops new software product concepts, designs, and/or enhancements to existing product design, that reflect market and user requirements. Conducts research and develops a good understanding of the customer's needs, new technologies, trends in the market, and competitors.
Work with leadership to create a product strategy and roadmap for your team, optimizing for speed to market
Create scope of work, project plans, development schedules, and quality assurance of tasks
Collect & document user requirements for feature requests at a high level.
Create & review use cases and test plans with design & engineering teams and coordinate communication between development and customers to refine requirements.
Create wireframes & diagrams to convey complex structures in design, data structure, function flow, etc.
Run sprinting planning, provide prioritization & retrospectives of tasks
Groom the backlog, supporting development process with Agile methodologies (Scrum, Iteration), manage capacity across iterations.
Ensure that product requirements are communicated effectively to all stakeholders, to include customers, design teams, development teams, and quality assurance.
Define learning agenda and key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success/failure and velocity trends (burn up/burn down charts)
Prioritize features and tasks for the product using internal tools, tracking and reviewing the product direction and current work frequently.
Manage collaboration and communication with other teams, both internal and external, to ensure teams have what they need and can work efficiently.
Regularly and systematically use data to uncover opportunities, track product performance, and drive decision making.
Manage full software product development lifecycle of the team.
Ability to effectively organize and present data in a format that is easily consumable by non-technical users
 Leadership & General Responsibilities:
Anticipate and define customer needs and achieve high quality results for both internal and external customers.
Understand business processes impacted by product.
Maintain close relationship with business team members; capable of identifying and solving issues in a manner to stay within the scope, yet to deliver solutions meeting business needs and expectations.
Track and manage issues and problems;
Escalate issues to appropriate levels as necessary to ensure that decisions are made timely and with the best interest of the scope and deliverables.
Influence others without direct reporting relationship/responsibility.
Assess own ideas and persuades others; gains support and commitment from others; mobilizes people to take action.
Anticipate and accept changing roles, directions, and work processes.
Effectively explore alternative approaches and solutions and to gain support and acceptance of all parties.
Provide input in the development and implementation of project management processes, operations and best practice solutions.
Keep technical knowledge updated. 
Other duties as assigned
 
Minimum Education
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field or equivalent experience
Minimum Special Certifications or technical skills
Must be an expert user of word processing, spreadsheet, database, graphic presentations, and project management software 
good understand of web and mobile technologies, including JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
Minimum Type of experience the job requires
Requires 2+ years of technical product management experience in technology industries such as creating strategic product roadmaps and working with cross-functional teams. 
Familiarity with agile software development methodologies is also a plus
Experience driving product vision, go-to-market strategy, and design discussions
Other
Ability to write user stories and draw process flow diagrams
Determination to do what is needed to accomplish goals of the team and of the company
Applicants in the U.S. and Canada must satisfy federal, state, provincial and local legal requirements of the job. Support Center - Irving

As a Sr. Data Engineer, you gather and understand data requirements, build consensus around design, architecture & business logic with your team, and work to achieve high quality & scalable data pipelines to solve the business problem. You will be building systems that deals with huge amounts of data coming from multiple sources outside of company. You must have passion for solving business problems with data, learning new technologies & diving deep into data to maintain high quality data warehouse. You are well versed in multiple technologies & architecture patterns to solve particular business problem at hand.
In this role, you will play a key part in building, scaling & maintaining the backbone of our AI & Analytics platform to help out clients in achieving better digital presence. You will be working in fast pace environment where solving business problem is the highest priority. Your efforts to collect, organize, and share data will impact nearly every employee & client and will be highly visible across the organization. If working on cutting edge technology, solving business problems and making a difference excites you, this is the job for you!!
Basic Qualifications AWS- Snowflake. Looker, GCP
6-7 team members product aligned
5+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role
5+ years of industry experience in software development, data engineering,
business intelligence, data science, or related field
5+ years of experience in SQL & Python
Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, or a
related technical discipline
Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and building ETL pipelines
Proven track record of solving complex business problem with high quality &
automated testing in agile environment.
Experience using one of the big data technologies (Spark, EMR, Dbt cloud
etc)
Excellent communication & analytics skills
Proven experience of working with cross functional teams
Experience of leading team through complex design and architecture
Experience with automated testing
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working with AWS big data technologies (EMR, Redshift, S3, Lambda, RDS)
Experience working with Snowflake
Demonstrated strength in data modeling, ETL development, and data
warehousing
Good understanding of any other programming languages like Java or JavaScript
Experience working with one of big data schedulers like Airflow, Oozie, Azkaban etc.
Experience in data streaming with Kafka, Spark Streaming and Kinesis
Basic knowledge on Containerization and Orchestration like Docker, Kubernetes
Understanding of python data libraries like NumPy, Scikit-Learn etc.
Open to learn new technologies & AI libraries
SQL, Python, Looker, GCP, AWS, Big Data, Snowflake, Spark, EMR, Kafka As a Sr. Data Engineer, you gather and understand data requirements, build consensus around design, architecture & business logic with your team, and work to achieve high quality & scalable data pipelines to solve the business problem. You will be building systems that deals with huge amounts of data coming from multiple sources outside of company. You must have passion for solving business problems with data, learning new technologies & diving deep into data to maintain high quality data warehouse. You are well versed in multiple technologies & architecture patterns to solve particular business problem at hand.
In this role, you will play a key part in building, scaling & maintaining the backbone of our AI & Analytics platform to help out clients in achieving better digital presence. You will be working in fast pace environment where solving business problem is the highest priority. Your efforts to collect, organize, and share data will impact nearly every employee & client and will be highly visible across the organization. If working on cutting edge technology, solving business problems and making a difference excites you, this is the job for you!!

6-7 team members product aligned
5+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role
5+ years of industry experience in software development, data engineering,
business intelligence, data science, or related field
5+ years of experience in SQL & Python

related technical discipline

Proven track record of solving complex business problem with high quality &
automated testing in agile environment.

etc)
Excellent communication & analytics skills
Proven experience of working with cross functional teams
Experience of leading team through complex design and architecture
Experience with automated testing

warehousing

job_title: Retail Associate Part Time Now Hiring
job_text:
All 1,000 of our Marshalls stores embrace discovery, from designer luggage to statement shoes. Our assortment of brands is always changing, but our mission to provide the surprises that make the everyday a little more fun is unwavering. Just like working here. Everyone encourages each other and embraces the excitement that can come with change. Each shift is a new opportunity to Discover Different.
Posting Notes: Marshalls Store 0180 || 17261 17th Street || Tustin || CA || 92780
 Job Summary:   
 Responsible for delivering a highly satisfied customer experience demonstrated by engaging and interacting with all customers, embodying customer experience principals and philosophy, and maintaining a clean and organized store environment. Adheres to all operational, merchandise, and loss prevention standards. May be cross-trained to work in multiple areas of the store in order to support the needs of the business. 
 Responsibilities: 
  Role models established customer experience practices with internal and external customers   Supports and embodies a positive store culture through honesty, integrity, and respect   Accurately rings customer purchases/returns and counts change back to customer according to established operating procedures   Promotes credit and loyalty programs during customer interactions   Maintains and upholds merchandising philosophy and follows established merchandising procedures and standards   Accurately processes and prepares merchandise for the sales floor following company procedures and standards   Initiates and participates in store recovery as needed throughout the day   Maintains all organizational, cleanliness, and recovery standards for the sales floor and participates in the maintenance/cleanliness of the entire store   Provides and accepts ongoing recognition and constructive feedback   Adheres to all labor laws, policies, and procedures   Supports and participates in store shrink reduction goals and programs   Participates in safety awareness and maintenance of a risk-free environment   Performs other duties as assigned  
 Requirements: 
  Possesses excellent customer service skills   Able to work a flexible schedule to support business needs   Possesses strong organizational skills with attention to detail   Capable of handling multiple tasks at one time   Able to respond appropriately to changes in direction or unexpected situations   Possesses strong communication skills   Capable of lifting heavy objects with or without reasonable accommodation   Works effectively with peers and supervisors to accomplish tasks   Retail customer experience preferred  
We’re reinventing retail and helping people discover that next find that’s going to be their new signature look. You can be a part of their journey to look amazing.Our inventory is always changing and our approach is continually evolving, which means every day is another chance to Discover Different. In fact, that’s what it’s like throughout the entire TJX family, which includes TJ Maxx, HomeGoods, Sierra, and Homesense.
Discover Different also means we embrace each other’s differences and unique perspectives. We consider all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, gender identity and expression, marital or military status. We also provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act and applicable state and local law.

Summary
Our client is one of the top ranked ENR Contractors in the Twin Cities. They are looking for an experienced Assistant Project Manager to join their growing team. With an incredibly healthy pipeline for 2021 and beyond, this hire in integral for their commercial construction team.
Client Details
Our client is one of the top ranked ENR Contractors in the Twin Cities. They are looking for an experienced Assistant Project Manager to join their growing team. With an incredibly healthy pipeline for 2021 and beyond, this hire in integral for their commercial construction team.
Description
Completes materials "take-offs" and establishes cost estimates
Reviews project proposal, drawings and plans to determine time frame, funding limitations, procedures for accomplishing project, staffing requirements, and allotment of available resources to various phases of project
Develops relationships with subcontractors and maintains lists of subcontractors that perform quality work
Confers with project staff to outline work plan and to assign duties, responsibilities, and scope of authority
Directs and coordinates activities of project personnel to ensure project progresses on schedule and within prescribed budget
Prepares daily, weekly, monthly schedule to support and preserve the Contract Project Schedule
Reviews status reports prepared by project personnel and modifies schedules or plans as required
Dictates or prepares project reports for management, client, or others
Confers with project personnel to provide technical advice and to resolve problems
Coordinates project activities with activities of government regulatory or other governmental agencies
Profile
2+ years of construction experience
Strong background in Commercial Construction
Strong oral and written communication skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
The ability to work in a fast paced work environment
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
The desire to grow their career professionally
The desire to drive the growth of a highly reputable General Contractor
The desire to mentor some of the younger Project Managers
Strong track record with client relationships
Job Offer
Base salary of $70,000-$80,000, depending on experience
Performance based Bonus potential
Company Equity
Fast Tracked career progression
Family Oriented Company
Company truck
Competitive Family Health Insurance Plans
Paid Maternity/Paternity leave
401k plan with company contributions
Short term/Long term disability

MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.

Raytheon Intelligence & Space is looking for an individual to join the 
Cyber Information Assurance 
Aurora, CO
Active Top Secret Clearance with CI Polygraph required
GeoLogics is seeking a Security Engineer to ensure RMF requirements and new solutions for Assessment & Authorization (A&A) activities in Aurora, CO
Key responsibilities include:
• Prepare, organize and execute Security Assessments
• Ability to empathize and promote positive communication with all
• Security compliance & vulnerability scanning/remediation across multiple platforms and networks
• Preparing for, supporting and/or leading Security Test & Evaluation activities for program sell-off of security related requirements
• Performing hands-on technical security solutions for Off the Shelf and In-house Software/Network/Cloud infrastructure
Clearance Requirement: 
Must be a US Citizen with Current TS/SCI with CI Poly
Required Skills:
• Bachelor's degree 
• 6 years of demonstrated experience in cyber security to include practices, methodologies, associated technologies, application design, and/or experience in an operational environment including NIST and/or ICD 503 guidelines, directives, and security mandates
• Experience executing Assessment & Authorization (A&A) activities, including the collection of support documentation 
• Experience/knowledge of Risk Management Framework (RMF), NIST 800-53 and CNSSI 1253
• Experience with cyber security engineering projects and programs for U.S. Government clients
• Tenable Nessus 
• McAfee ePO/Symantec Enterprise 
• Security Certification in accordance with DoD 8570.01 IAT-II (e.g., Security+ CE) or higher (CISSP) is preferable
Desired Skills:
• XACTA (or SNOW) for documenting/processing RMF artifacts for IATT and ATO award decision
• Agile, Scrum, HW and SW life-cycle management, & engineering change proposal processes
• Hands-on technical experience 
                  o Linux system administration
                  o Network component administration
                  o VMware administration
                  o Operating system hardening
                  o Vulnerability Identification and Remediation
                  o High Speed Guard (HSG) Administration
• Patch management/deployment experience

Intelligence & Space

Salary Range: 19.2300 To 20.6700 (USD) Hourly
Best Buddies International is a nonprofit 501(c)(3) organization dedicated to establishing a global volunteer movement that creates opportunities for one-to-one friendships, integrated employment, leadership development, and inclusive living for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD).Best Buddies is the world’s largest organization dedicated to ending the social, physical and economic isolation of the 200 million people with intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD). Our programs empower the special abilities of people with IDD by helping them form meaningful friendships with their peers, secure successful jobs, live independently, improve public speaking, self-advocacy, and communication skills, and feel valued by society.
Job Title:  Program Manager, Mission Expansion
Department:  State Operations and Programs
Reports to: Director, Programs
Hourly rate: $19.23 - $20.67/hour 
Position Overview:  The PM, Mission Expansion is responsible for determining the needs for state growth and identifying new schools and corporations to develop Best Buddies chapters. In this capacity, the PM, Mission Expansion will select new programs, train chapter leaders (school and corporate) to advance engagement in the mission, facilitate the certification process to officially open Best Buddies programs, and track the ongoing certification process to ensure all chapter leaders meet mission standards. Key responsibilities may also include supporting other staff and volunteers to ensure chapters are engaged in the mission; meeting Best Buddies requirements; participating in programmatic events and initiatives; and identifying funding opportunities for state events. The PM, Mission Expansion will work closely with the state and national leadership to develop new funding sources, identify sponsors, and advance the mission through development opportunities in addition to chapter onboarding and volunteer management.
Job Qualifications – Qualified applicants must have:
Management/supervisory experience, fundraising experience including special event planning individual donor cultivation, major gift prospecting securing corporate and foundation grants/gifts, and/or personally soliciting major gifts.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience managing, driving, and motivating volunteers for the cultivation and solicitation of program development and special event support.
Strong desire and motivation to carry out the Best Buddies mission, with a focus on program advancement and staff development.
Exhibit strong initiative, drive for results, and self-assessment skills.
Have a clear understanding of multiple communication platforms and proficient use of social media, Best Buddies Online resources and tracking tools, Adcieo, and Microsoft Office.
Must be willing and able to travel frequently, use personal cell phone, and work evenings and weekends as necessary in order to accomplish job responsibilities.
Bachelor’s Degree and access to an automobile with applicable insurance.
Job Duties include, but are not limited to:
Programs
Determine state needs to expand Best Buddies programs in elementary, middle, and high schools, colleges, and at the citizen corporate level and through community buddy pairs. 
Work with the Program Supervisor and Area Director to identify schools and corporations to start Best Buddies chapters for youth and adults. 
Select and train chapter leaders in each program, specifically focused on the certification and ongoing training of school/corporate faculty to serve as chapter advisors. 
Track and evaluate completion of onboarding benchmarks to ensure all new chapters understand programmatic expectations to fully meet all Best Buddies goals, deadlines, and expectations.
Transition all chapters after one year of onboarding to the caseloads of the PM, Volunteers.
Manage Citizens Corporate and Community chapters; identify and onboard Corporate/Community Chapter leads and provide support to identified liaisons. 
Serves as communication point person for volunteer concerns, needs, and questions in the region.
Responsible for tracking all reporting and chapter updates using online platforms for the region. 
Identifies, cultivates, and develops volunteers capable of making personal commitments and becoming directly involved in the solicitation process on behalf of Best Buddies.
Help develop a pipeline for growth in the region by making contacts with schools, community groups, corporations, etc. as determined by Area Director.  
 Marketing and Fund Development
Assist with the identification and development of fundraising opportunities and partnerships to support regional events and/or programmatic support and expansion. 
Assist with planning and execution of regional events and partnerships as directed by the Area Director.  
Best Buddies® is an affirmative action employer, in addition to an EOE and M/F/V/PWD/PV employer. Diversity, equity, and inclusion are foundational to Best Buddies International’s core values and help the organization continue to achieve its mission. Here at Best Buddies, our goal is to lead and advocate for a more inclusive world.
Best Buddies offers a comprehensive and generous benefits programs that include financial security, health and wellness and time off. Salary Range: 19.2300 To 20.6700 (USD) Hourly
Best Buddies International is a nonprofit 501(c)(3) organization dedicated to establishing a global volunteer movement that creates opportunities for one-to-one friendships, integrated employment, leadership development, and inclusive living for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD).Best Buddies is the world’s largest organization dedicated to ending the social, physical and economic isolation of the 200 million people with intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD). Our programs empower the special abilities of people with IDD by helping them form meaningful friendships with their peers, secure successful jobs, live independently, improve public speaking, self-advocacy, and communication skills, and feel valued by society.
Job Title:  Program Manager, Mission Expansion
Department:  State Operations and Programs
Reports to: Director, Programs
Hourly rate: $19.23 - $20.67/hour 
Position Overview:  The PM, Mission Expansion is responsible for determining the needs for state growth and identifying new schools and corporations to develop Best Buddies chapters. In this capacity, the PM, Mission Expansion will select new programs, train chapter leaders (school and corporate) to advance engagement in the mission, facilitate the certification process to officially open Best Buddies programs, and track the ongoing certification process to ensure all chapter leaders meet mission standards. Key responsibilities may also include supporting other staff and volunteers to ensure chapters are engaged in the mission; meeting Best Buddies requirements; participating in programmatic events and initiatives; and identifying funding opportunities for state events. The PM, Mission Expansion will work closely with the state and national leadership to develop new funding sources, identify sponsors, and advance the mission through development opportunities in addition to chapter onboarding and volunteer management.
Job Qualifications – Qualified applicants must have:
Management/supervisory experience, fundraising experience including special event planning individual donor cultivation, major gift prospecting securing corporate and foundation grants/gifts, and/or personally soliciting major gifts.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience managing, driving, and motivating volunteers for the cultivation and solicitation of program development and special event support.
Strong desire and motivation to carry out the Best Buddies mission, with a focus on program advancement and staff development.
Exhibit strong initiative, drive for results, and self-assessment skills.
Have a clear understanding of multiple communication platforms and proficient use of social media, Best Buddies Online resources and tracking tools, Adcieo, and Microsoft Office.
Must be willing and able to travel frequently, use personal cell phone, and work evenings and weekends as necessary in order to accomplish job responsibilities.
Bachelor’s Degree and access to an automobile with applicable insurance.
Job Duties include, but are not limited to:
Programs
Determine state needs to expand Best Buddies programs in elementary, middle, and high schools, colleges, and at the citizen corporate level and through community buddy pairs. 
Work with the Program Supervisor and Area Director to identify schools and corporations to start Best Buddies chapters for youth and adults. 
Select and train chapter leaders in each program, specifically focused on the certification and ongoing training of school/corporate faculty to serve as chapter advisors. 
Track and evaluate completion of onboarding benchmarks to ensure all new chapters understand programmatic expectations to fully meet all Best Buddies goals, deadlines, and expectations.
Transition all chapters after one year of onboarding to the caseloads of the PM, Volunteers.
Manage Citizens Corporate and Community chapters; identify and onboard Corporate/Community Chapter leads and provide support to identified liaisons. 
Serves as communication point person for volunteer concerns, needs, and questions in the region.
Responsible for tracking all reporting and chapter updates using online platforms for the region. 
Identifies, cultivates, and develops volunteers capable of making personal commitments and becoming directly involved in the solicitation process on behalf of Best Buddies.
Help develop a pipeline for growth in the region by making contacts with schools, community groups, corporations, etc. as determined by Area Director.  
 Marketing and Fund Development
Assist with the identification and development of fundraising opportunities and partnerships to support regional events and/or programmatic support and expansion. 
Assist with planning and execution of regional events and partnerships as directed by the Area Director.  
Best Buddies® is an affirmative action employer, in addition to an EOE and M/F/V/PWD/PV employer. Diversity, equity, and inclusion are foundational to Best Buddies International’s core values and help the organization continue to achieve its mission. Here at Best Buddies, our goal is to lead and advocate for a more inclusive world.

job_title: TJ Maxx Retail Customer Experience Coordinator Part Time
job_text:
Style is never in short supply at our more than 1,000 TJ Maxx stores. They all have different products, but the same commitment to the thrill of the find. From designers straight off the runway to statement jewelry, we offer exciting surprises that make the everyday a little more fun. Same with working here. Our environment is ever-changing, yet always encouraging. Each shift is a new opportunity to Discover Different.
Posting Notes: TJ Maxx Store 0255 || 4821 Kietzke Lane || Reno || NV || 89509
 Job Summary:  
 Responsible for promoting an excellent customer experience. Oversees a team of Associates at front of store ensuring prompt, courteous customer service and promotion of loyalty programs. Leads by example by engaging and interacting with all customers, and maintaining a clean and organized store. 
 Responsibilities: 
  Role models exceptional customer service   Creates a positive internal and external customer experience   Promotes a culture of honesty and integrity; maintains confidentiality   Takes an active role in training and mentoring Associates on front end principals using appropriate company resources and tools   Trains and coaches Associates on personalizing the customer experience while promoting loyalty programs   Assigns registers, supports and responds to POS coverage needs, and coordinates breaks for all Associates   Addresses customer concerns and issues promptly, ensuring a positive customer experience   Ensures Associates execute tasks and daily activities in accordance with store plan; reprioritizes as needed   Communicates accurately and effectively with management and Associates when setting and addressing priorities; provides periodic progress updates   Provides and accepts ongoing recognition and constructive feedback   Partners with Management on Associate training needs to increase effectiveness   Ensures adherence to all labor laws, policies, and procedures   Promotes credit and loyalty programs during customer interactions   Supports and participates in store shrink reduction goals and programs   Promotes safety awareness and supports maintenance of a risk-free environment   Performs other duties as assigned  
 Requirements: 
  Available to work flexible schedule to support business needs, including nights and weekends.   Strong understanding of merchandising techniques   Capable of handling multiple tasks at one time   Strong organizational skills with attention to detail   Ability to respond appropriately to changes in direction or unexpected situations   Team player, working effectively with peers and supervisors to accomplish tasks   Strong communication skills   Ability to train others   One year retail and 6 months of leadership experience.  
At TJ Maxx there’s so much potential to discover something new. A new day means new merchandise, and a fresh chance to reinvent retail. Discover Different means that we want you to bring your whole self and your sense of style to work with you every day - just as Associates do throughout the entire TJX family, which includes Marshalls, HomeGoods, Sierra, and Homesense.
Discover Different also means we embrace each other’s differences and unique perspectives. We consider all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, gender identity and expression, marital or military status. We also provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act and applicable state and local law.

Borrego is seeking an Associate Project Developer to join our growing team in our Lowell, MA office. We offer a hybrid work environment, allowing you to work remotely 2-3 days a week and from the office 2-3 days a week.
At Borrego, we don’t accept the status quo. We are driven by a culture of teamwork, fearless thinking, and adaptability as we pursue our mission to accelerate the adoption of renewable energy. With more than 850 MW already installed, we’re excited about the “Gigawatt Revolution” happening across our company as we shift from megawatts to gigawatts of clean energy in the coming years.
After 40 years in business, Borrego is a trusted name in the solar industry and well-known for our strong employee culture. We combine the stability and wisdom gained by decades in business with an entrepreneurial spirit. Our employees are driven and animated by the [Link available when viewing the job], an operating framework detailing our mission, vision, strategy, and cultural principles and working systems.
About the Role
The Associate Project Developer contributes directly to the success of the company by effectively and efficiently identifying leads that will turn into project opportunities. The APD is a key support position and is vital to Borrego’s go-to-market strategy in the region they are assigned.
This position is an opportunity to join an outstanding company in a high-leverage role. Our ideal applicant will be a tenacious, determined, creative problem-solver, self-motivated and independent, a great communicator, and highly organized, with the ability to manage numerous tasks in parallel, and to prioritize competing demands.
The Associate Project Developer (APD) contributes directly to the success of the company by effectively and efficiently identifying strategic development opportunities and screening prospective sites that will turn into project opportunities.  The APD is a key support position and is vital to Borrego’s go-to-market strategy.  Our most accomplished APD’s bring an enthusiasm for renewable development, have strong writing, analytical and organizational skills, and a hunger to successfully drive the growth of our pipeline.
Position responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:
Prospecting
Using a GIS-based approach to target land parcels that have high potential hosting capacity for solar and energy storage.  APDs identify and research leads through targeted campaign work, including mailers, phone calls, and other outreach.   Using our Salesforce CRM system, you will document all opportunities and take point on calling landowners and then creating due diligence packages for Project Developers to review.  Once landowner interest has been established, you will successfully transition qualified opportunities to project developers and schedule initial meetings with potential landowners for the Project Developers on your team. 
Project Due Diligence/Entitlement Management
Borrego utilizes a Value Stream Mapping (VSM)  process that takes a lean approach in managing opportunities from initial discovery through to closing.  Project due diligence tasks you will be responsible for include: desktop reviews of potential site characteristics including topography, soil conditions, access, interconnection potential, and the likelihood of wetlands, among other things.  Your management will extend into requesting quotes and releasing additional on-site work such as surveying, wetlands flagging, site walks, etc. Using our Salesforce system, you will update project budgets and create construction requisitions.   In addition, you will be responsible for monitoring and managing the completion of site discovery items that are prepared by subcontractors.   
Market Diligence
Due to the dynamic nature of our industry, ideal projects often evolve over time as new technology is introduced and policy adapts to meet the demands of the regional energy markets.  The APD often plays a key role in spotting these trends and forming a hypothesis on what the future opportunities offer.  Strong analytical thinking and experience building sensitivity models in Excel is a desirable quality for a person in this role.
Additional duties include:
Initiate and send initial LOIs and leases
Follow up with Authority Having Jurisdiction (AHJ) administrators for timely delivery of decision documents
Complete cash flow models to assess the impact of changing cost or incentive conditions on projects
Review RFPs and complete RFP questionnaires to allow Project Developers to assess bid viability
Support the company’s efforts towards continuous improvement and standard process development
Desired Skills and Experience
While no one individual will possess them all, the successful candidate will bring many of the following experiences, skills, and attributes:
Bachelor’s Degree
2 to 5 years’ experience in a quota-based sales role or participation in a formal corporate sales training program
Solar sales or development experience preferred
Experience in proposal writing and/or responding to Requests for Proposals (RFPs)
IT skills – proficient in Microsoft Office, Salesforce experience a plus
Compensation, Benefits, and CultureBorrego uses an internally equitable and externally competitive total cash approach to compensation. Our comprehensive benefits package includes dental, vision, health, life, and disability insurance; 401(k) plan with company match and immediate vesting; continuing education and professional development assistance; access to Borrego’s wellness platform; and self-managed flexible work schedules and time-off policies.
Our corporate culture fosters bold moves, a growth mindset, and the ability to take risks — and we value innovative thinkers who will help us reach our ambitious growth goals. We believe that flexibility and work-life balance are important parts of long-term employee happiness and productivity. Our employees are trusted to get their work done and are given the freedom to do so when they are their most efficient, creative, and engaged.
Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
Borrego values the diverse perspectives, skills, experiences, and contributions of all employees. We want all our employees to feel like they belong and are empowered to be their most authentic selves at work. We’re actively committed to fostering diversity not only within our own organization but also within the renewable energy industry.
We seek a diverse candidate pool in this – and every – search. Borrego provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, disability, genetics, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by state, federal and local laws. In addition to federal law requirements, Borrego complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. EEO M/F/D/V.
A Note to Third-Party Recruiters
Borrego\u0027s People + Culture team coordinates all recruiting and hiring at our company. Borrego does not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters, staffing firms, or related agencies. Resumes are only accepted from third-party recruiters, staffing firms, or related agencies if a signed agreement is in place AND if external recruiting assistance is authorized by the People + Culture team for a specific position. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Borrego. Borrego is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. We offer a hybrid work environment, allowing you to work remotely 2-3 days a week and from the office 2-3 days a week.

Strategic Staffing Solutions is hiring for a Application Developer! 
 This is a Contract Opportunity with our company that MUST be worked on a W2 ONLY, NO visa sponsorship or C2C eligibility for this position. The details are below. 
 Duration: 12 months 
 Location: Charlotte, NC (onsite with some remote) 
 Job Description 
 Maintains and enhances existing applications.  Troubleshoots and debugs applications, including user and system interface functionality.  Collaborates with cross-functional teams and clients to define, design, and deliver enhancements, new applications, and technical solutions that meet the needs of the company, its clients, and the end users. Description:Sr. Developer - Application  Job Overview and Responsibilities  The Client IT team designs, develops and maintains massively scaling technology solutions that are brought to life with innovative architectures, data analytics and digital solutions.  Full Stack Developer Wanted!! If you're interested in a career that involves using the latest technologies Application development, please look no further. Client is seeking talented and motivated application services developers to be a part of their Tech Ops Mobile Application s teams in Houston, TX. The Digital Innovation Application Developer will partner with the Technical Operation team and IT to develop, program, and test various solutions dealing with the latest technologies to support wide range of Applications. In the evolving Digital Tech Ops space, new data analytics, website designing, cloud deployments and service architecture technologies appear in the market at a frequent pace. This changing landscape requires a versatile team that is in touch with the market, passionate about new technology, while at the same time able to understand the needs of our customers and how emerging technology can improve the customer experience.  Partner with the Tech Ops team and IT to prepare and program various projects related to the latest IT technologies Deliver across the entire app life cycle from concept, design, build, deploy, test, release support Good understanding .Net/.Net Core Framework, Web API/Web Services/WCF and SQL/Oracle development. Be part of team to deliver state of the backend solutions to support mobile applications across the different functions Well versed with Microsoft technology - C#, .Net Core,.NET, ASP.NET, XML, HTML, SQL Server -2012, 2016, 2017 Extensive experience in developing web pages using HTML/HTML5, XML, DHTML CSS/CSS3, SASS, LESS, JavaScript, React JS, Redux, Flex, Angular JS (1.X) jQuery, JSON, Node.js, Ajax, JQUERY Bootstrap. Experienced in MEAN stack development Mongo dB, Express, Node, and Angular. Experience in all phase of SDLC like Requirement Analysis, Implementation and Maintenance, and extensive experience with Agile and SCRUM. Extensive knowledge in developing single - page applications (SPAs). Working knowledge of Web protocols and standards (HTTP HTML5/XHTML/XHTML-MP, CSS3, Web Forms, XML, XML parsers) Good experience on customizing CSS frameworks like Bootstrap and Foundation using CSS pre-processors LESS or SASS and Compass. Implemented easy to use Bootstrap plugins for building carousel, accordion, modal windows etc. Good Expertise in analyzing the Document Object Model (DOM) Layout, DOM Functions, and Java Script functions, Cascading Styles across cross-browser using Fire Bug, Developer Tool Bar. Expertise in React JS framework to develop the SPA. Experienced in React JS and working with React Flux architecture. Experienced in working with Redux architecture using complex Object-Oriented concepts in improving the performance of the websites. Experience in using React JS components, Forms, Events, Keys, Router, plus Redux, Animations and Flux concept. Good Experience in React.js for creating interactive UI's using One-way data flow, Virtual DOM, JSX, React Native concepts. Familiar with creating Custom Reusable React Components Library. Experience in Node environment using Node.js, NPM, Grunt, Gulp, Groovy Bower. Strong in using the Node.js, and Require.js and MVC Frameworks in the development of the web application Experience with front-end development with back-end system integration. Proficient in using Unit.js testing framework along with Jasmine, Karma, Protractor, Mocha test runners Experienced in Automating, Configuring, and deploying instances on AWS, Azure environments, and Data centers, also familiar with EC2, Cloud watch, Cloud Formation and managing security groups on AWS. In depth Knowledge of AWS cloud service like Compute, Network, Storage, and Identity & access management. Responsible for ensuring Systems & Network Security, maintaining performance, and setting up monitoring using Cloud Watch. Experience in working on version controller tools like GitHub (GIT), TFS, SVN etc. Excellent communication and Inter-Personal Skills, well organized, goal oriented.  Required Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems and/or equivalent work experience Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Able to manage multiple priorities and deliverables, both short and long-term, in a busy and aggressive environment Must be self-motivated, possess strong communication skills and be able to work in a team oriented environment  Preferred Master s Degree in Computer Science/Information Systems Basic knowledge of networking Mongo DB, NoSQL, TeamCity, Microsoft TFS Airline experience a plus Microsoft/AWS certifications a plus This client requires anyone who is to report onsite to be fully vaccinated by their start date. This will be hybrid to start. 1 or 2 days a week in office max, but also potential for a week with no in office days. Discover. A brighter future.
With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day & We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.  Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover. Job Description What You’ll Do
Develop predictive models to support Discover’s business partners.
Design and develop models, utilizing machine learning and other algorithms.
Present the results of mathematical modeling and data analysis to management or other end users.
 How You’ll Do It
Research and leverage state-of-the-art modeling techniques; participate in modeling innovation.
Leverage extensive, deep technical knowledge and leadership skills to drive the development of data-science solutions, and implement data-driven recommendations and outcomes.
Maintain a high level of competency in statistical and analytical principles, tools and techniques, and support the advancement of the "best-in-class" analytical capabilities to unlock new capabilities and performance, and quickly adapt to modern modeling techniques.
Demonstrate knowledge in analytical tools.
 Qualifications You’ll Need 
The Basics
Master's degree in statistics, math, analytics, computer science, engineering, economics, or related quantitative field
 
Bonus Points If You Have
Ph.D. in math, computer science, engineering, economics, or related quantitative field
2+ years of experience in developing data-based analytical solutions, financial service industry, modeling, or related field
What are you waiting for? Apply today! The same way we treat our employees is how we treat all applicants – with respect. Discover Financial Services is an equal opportunity employer [Link available when viewing the job]. We thrive on diversity & inclusion. You will be treated fairly throughout our recruiting process and without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status in consideration for a career at Discover. A New Jersey-based services organization is currently seeking an experienced Project Manager for a promising Senior-level position with their growing staff. In this role, the Senior Project Manager will be primarily responsibility for planning, organizing, managing, and controlling complex projects across information technology.
Responsibilities:
 The Senior Project Manager will: 
 Lead the Project team to define scope, capture business requirements, and create project schedule(s) Identify project staffing (resource) needs Host regularly scheduled project meetings with the Project team members and stakeholders Ensure availability of funding and resources required to complete assigned project(s) successfully Provide status reports to project stakeholders on a regular cadence Act as a primary liaison between sponsor, stakeholders, team members, and vendors Plan, track, and manage activities and milestones throughout the project lifecycle Conduct risk assessments; report identified risks to stakeholders; and, provide recommendations for risk responses Manage risks and issues to ensure minimal impact to delivery Communicate and collaborate with business partners to ensure appropriate training Perform other related duties, as assigned 
Qualifications:
 7+ years experience leading large, complex projects Bachelor's Degree in Business, Computer Science, and/or Engineering Demonstrated experience forming, organizing, and leading project teams from initiation to implementation Experience with Planview or other PPM Tools (Clarity, HP PPM, etc.) Familiar with Scrum Client facing experience Microsoft Office Suite proficient (Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Project, etc.) Solid analytical and problem solving skills Great interpersonal skills Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) Strong attention to detail Highly organized 
Desired Skills:

At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives. We’re a purpose-driven company, and our beliefs are the foundation of how we conduct business every day. We’re guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Collectively, these values inspire us to work together as One Team with our customers at the center of everything we do, and to take care of ourselves, each other, and the communities in which we live and work. We challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. Join us as we enable the hopes, dreams, and ambitions of millions of people around the world.The Enterprise Cyber Security Product Development Team is the research and development arm of PayPal’s Enterprise Cyber Security Organization. The team is tasked with building & maintaining best in class security platforms (such as crypto, SOAR - Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response, fraud prevention and attack mitigation) that keep PayPal and millions of users safe online. As PayPal continues its march towards a billion active users, the demand for resilience and scale from the team’s products has never been greater. ECS Product Development teams are structured to excel through collaboration and by supporting each other. Our focus is on teaming with smart engineers who are passionate about their craft and excited to build software for our unique solutions in the space. In our teams, developers have the chance to work on various teams and stacks. Here’s a bit more about us: • We build what we love and we own what we build. We take great care to build the best products and we ensure its quality through all life stages of the product. • Communication is key to our process, and we don't want to hinder it with walls. Many teams program in pairs, which means you always have another set of eyes to help you. • We practice test-driven development and believe that it helps us deliver simple solutions focused on real customer needs. We have no QA department – developers test, release and monitor their own code. • We keep the team in sync with daily stand-ups and have regular retrospectives to discuss things that are going well and opportunities for improvements. • We value unique perspectives brought by diverse backgrounds and experiences. A broad range of ideas and perspectives help us to create the best possible product. Do you enjoy building large scale applications that are integral to the success of the company? Are you passionate about driving innovation and delivering quality products that delight customers? As a Staff Software Engineer on the Enterprise Cyber Security Crypto team, you will be responsible for building the next generation of cryptography & security products that support our ever-growing digital payments & wallet products in the cloud. You will be making key technology decisions, building & maintaining large production grade distributed systems, collaborating with other senior engineers and managers to envision systems that will keep PayPal and our customers safe well into the future. Mentoring other engineers is an important success criterion for this role.  
Anchor major team initiatives to build and improve high impact distributed security and crypto systems, grow the scale of our products, reduce complexity, and burn down technical debt  
Develop solutions that bring industry leading security and crypto practices to PayPal and that solve the needs of our customers and compliance teams with an eye towards self-service products backed by efficient operations  
Mentor & grow other software engineers 
Be ready to exercise [Link available when viewing the job] to deliver high quality output 
Lead detailed code-reviews and provide constructive feedback to team-mates 
Leverage agile processes & practices to ensure the highest levels of operational resiliency & security standards 
Collaborate with leadership, peers, product & program management, and customers to effectively to deliver solutions and projects  
Support production systems 24/7 (Team rotation based) 
Lead Blameless Postmortems for production incidents 
Own products & services and delight customers everyday 
Be kind and help others 
  Qualifications
5+ years of experience in software engineering, programming with Java, NodeJS, Python or Go 
Design and Operational Experience with large scale production grade secure distributed systems  
Comfortable with multi-threaded applications and development of REST based APIs 
Good Linux skills and understanding of the operating systems  
Good working knowledge of data structures, algorithms, software design & patterns 
Clean development practices including writing extensive unit & functional test cases (that also cover non-functional requirements like security, availability and performance) and using Continuous integration and deployment practices right from the beginning. 
 Nice to have skills
Knowledge of Applied Cryptography (Symmetric/Asymmetric Keys Algorithms, certificates, TLS) 
Understanding of AWS or GCP technologies  
Experience with Docker and Kubernetes  
Experience with monitoring/logging tools and best practices  
Experience with OpenSSL Libraries 
Experience with C++ 
 We know the [Link available when viewing the job] and [Link available when viewing the job] can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don't hesitate to apply.  
For more than 20 years, PayPal has remained at the forefront of the digital payment revolution. By leveraging technology to make financial services and commerce more convenient, affordable, and secure, our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 400 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying, or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom, enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at [Email available when viewing the job].R0077277 At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives. We’re a purpose-driven company, and our beliefs are the foundation of how we conduct business every day. We’re guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Collectively, these values inspire us to work together as One Team with our customers at the center of everything we do, and to take care of ourselves, each other, and the communities in which we live and work. We challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. Join us as we enable the hopes, dreams, and ambitions of millions of people around the world.The Enterprise Cyber Security Product Development Team is the research and development arm of PayPal’s Enterprise Cyber Security Organization. The team is tasked with building & maintaining best in class security platforms (such as crypto, SOAR - Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response, fraud prevention and attack mitigation) that keep PayPal and millions of users safe online. As PayPal continues its march towards a billion active users, the demand for resilience and scale from the team’s products has never been greater. ECS Product Development teams are structured to excel through collaboration and by supporting each other. Our focus is on teaming with smart engineers who are passionate about their craft and excited to build software for our unique solutions in the space. In our teams, developers have the chance to work on various teams and stacks. Here’s a bit more about us: • We build what we love and we own what we build. We take great care to build the best products and we ensure its quality through all life stages of the product. • Communication is key to our process, and we don't want to hinder it with walls. Many teams program in pairs, which means you always have another set of eyes to help you. • We practice test-driven development and believe that it helps us deliver simple solutions focused on real customer needs. We have no QA department – developers test, release and monitor their own code. • We keep the team in sync with daily stand-ups and have regular retrospectives to discuss things that are going well and opportunities for improvements. • We value unique perspectives brought by diverse backgrounds and experiences. A broad range of ideas and perspectives help us to create the best possible product. Do you enjoy building large scale applications that are integral to the success of the company? Are you passionate about driving innovation and delivering quality products that delight customers? As a Staff Software Engineer on the Enterprise Cyber Security Crypto team, you will be responsible for building the next generation of cryptography & security products that support our ever-growing digital payments & wallet products in the cloud. You will be making key technology decisions, building & maintaining large production grade distributed systems, collaborating with other senior engineers and managers to envision systems that will keep PayPal and our customers safe well into the future. Mentoring other engineers is an important success criterion for this role.  
Anchor major team initiatives to build and improve high impact distributed security and crypto systems, grow the scale of our products, reduce complexity, and burn down technical debt  
Develop solutions that bring industry leading security and crypto practices to PayPal and that solve the needs of our customers and compliance teams with an eye towards self-service products backed by efficient operations  
Mentor & grow other software engineers 
Be ready to exercise [Link available when viewing the job] to deliver high quality output 
Lead detailed code-reviews and provide constructive feedback to team-mates 
Leverage agile processes & practices to ensure the highest levels of operational resiliency & security standards 
Collaborate with leadership, peers, product & program management, and customers to effectively to deliver solutions and projects  
Support production systems 24/7 (Team rotation based) 
Lead Blameless Postmortems for production incidents 
Own products & services and delight customers everyday 
Be kind and help others 
  Qualifications
5+ years of experience in software engineering, programming with Java, NodeJS, Python or Go 
Design and Operational Experience with large scale production grade secure distributed systems  
Comfortable with multi-threaded applications and development of REST based APIs 
Good Linux skills and understanding of the operating systems  
Good working knowledge of data structures, algorithms, software design & patterns 
Clean development practices including writing extensive unit & functional test cases (that also cover non-functional requirements like security, availability and performance) and using Continuous integration and deployment practices right from the beginning. 
 Nice to have skills
Knowledge of Applied Cryptography (Symmetric/Asymmetric Keys Algorithms, certificates, TLS) 
Understanding of AWS or GCP technologies  
Experience with Docker and Kubernetes  
Experience with monitoring/logging tools and best practices  
Experience with OpenSSL Libraries 
Experience with C++

We need two individuals who can greatly influence any organization, from constructiveness and commitment to providing superior customer service. You’ll be privileged to learn and grow with a progressive-minded tech company while being instrumental in resolving incoming customer phone calls. This is a well-paying, long-term role; rightfully suited for experienced individuals who exude a poised demeanor, who are no stranger to working within a team focused environment. 
 Starting Pay Rate for Administrative Assistant is set at a flat  $17.00 per hour  (non-negotiable) Starting Pay Rate for Customer Care is set at  $16.50 per hour 
   Comprehensive Benefits Offered:  
  Healthcare + Dental Coverage package   Twelve (12) Paid Holidays   401(k) plan with matching contributions  
The customer service position will have meaningful conversations with existing customers that will involve: 
 Resolving inbound calls by verifying customers and actively listening to their concern(s) Answering common questions of customers which often pertain to the details their current plan, or product(s) they've ordered Confirming customer orders and/or delivery expectations Relaying customer information in order to identify needs and/or clarify certain items Proactively recommending new or alternative solutions for customers that express a particular service need Dispatching incoming customer service inquiries over to the technical support team as needed  The admin will carry out administrative support tasks consisting of: 
 Wordpress data entry of product changes, additions, and updates Overseeing social media account maintenance Assigned projects aimed at customer order retention  Working Culture: A positive spirited, inspiring, forward-thinking organization that greatly values employee autonomy and collaboration. Located at 1355 Lynnfield Road in Memphis. 
 
What we're looking for... 
 Strong customer service and problem solving skills to interact with all levels – from admins to upper management and customers A person who gives customers personal attention can go a long way in establishing their positive experience with the service the company provides Advanced skills in Microsoft 365, including Excel, PPT, Word Outlook, and virtual meetings and conference tools Those who are able to effectively present information over the phone and small group situations to customers, and other employees   Full-Time, Direct Hire / Permanent 
Shifts Available: 
 S1: 10:30am - 6:30pm Monday - Friday S3: 1:00pm - 9:00pm Monday - Friday S4: 3:00pm - 11:00pm Monday - Friday   
Other administrative tasks expected for the admin may include: Providing logistical customer support and set-up equipment for webinars and video conferences for customers & their service account manager. Notating customer account memos, generating customer reports, and other data. Providing clerical assistance unrelated to customer service such as filing, copying and sorting, the pick up and distribution of mail, & delivery of email newsletters. Scheduling customer service call backs in addition to zoom sessions where you will have to use your knowledge and judgment of priorities. Lastly, you will always have to ensure customer service concerns are resolved in a timely manner.

L3Harris is dedicated to recruiting and developing diverse, high-performing talent who are passionate about what they do. Our employees are unified in a shared dedication to our customers’ mission and quest for professional growth. L3Harris provides an inclusive, engaging environment designed to empower employees and promote work-life success. Fundamental to our culture is an unwavering focus on values, dedication to our communities, and commitment to excellence in everything we do. 
L3Harris Technologies is an agile global aerospace and defense technology innovator, delivering end-to-end solutions that meet customers’ mission-critical needs. The company provides advanced defense and commercial technologies across air, land, sea, space and cyber domains. L3Harris has approximately $18 billion in annual revenue and 48,000 employees, with customers in more than 100 countries.   Description: 
Job Title: Mission Assurance Lead
Job Code: SAS20211709-69547
Job Location:
 Palm Bay, FL
Job Description: ­­
The Mission Assurance Lead will be responsible for leading mission assurance activities to provide independent oversight for the respective system designs, product builds, testing, integration and support required for programs within the Space and Airborne business segment. The position will report to the Mission Assurance Senior Manager. The candidate will be responsible for driving continual process and product improvement ensuring product and process integrity, leading to customer satisfaction, overall mission success while supporting division quality, delivery and cost targets. This is a hands-on, highly involved position.
Essential Functions: 
Hands on leader with responsibility for resolving technical challenges, ensuring successful tactical execution, as well as creating and implementing the strategic vision for the Quality and Mission Assurance department.
Work closely with the program teams and the functional organizations in a DOD environment to ensure that all phases of the customer life cycle, from early customer involvement through post-delivery support, meet the requirements for mission success. 
Responsible for the maintenance of quality records that document the quality status of material/products and provide necessary information and cumulative data for internal and external Customer responses.
Review and verify compliance of all Work Package Descriptions (WPDs) issued for Quality tasks for proposals and ongoing contracts/projects.
Develop and implement Quality plans and programs promoting sound and effective principles as set forth in company procedures, government standards and directives, and commercially proven methodology and ensure that the department conforms to these principles.
Improve the efficiency of the Quality organization through effective leadership, individual and group training, and process improvement.
Lead implementation of new processes, activities, and culture that enhance the customer experience and engage every employee in a quality focused mindset.
Utilize Cost of Poor Quality data to improve yields and reduce rework during engineering and manufacturing efforts.
Take a lead role in building a culture that reinforces compliance with appropriate laws, regulations and/or guidelines and internal command media.
Maintain certification and compliance efforts for AS9100, and CMMI and other required certifications.
Verify subcontractor inspection or technical document preparation procedures to verify compliance with contract requirements.
Perform design reviews and facilitate design and quality concurrent Engineering.
Provide independent evaluation of technical gate reviews to ensure technical rigor is being applied to the process.
Collection and analysis of internal performance metrics to develop zero defect plans and report to senior leadership on business performance including action plans to improve business execution and status of strategic initiatives.
Qualifications: 
Bachelor of Science degree in an Engineering discipline or technical equivalent with 9+ years of experience or Master's degree with 7+ years of experience. 
Quality management or operations leadership experience.
Preferred Additional Skills:
Space Systems engineering experience with hardware development processes related to Space Systems.
In depth knowledge of quality and reliability methods and procedures for hardware and software systems as they apply to the aerospace or electronic industry.
Greenbelt or Blackbelt certification and/or proven education or work history in leading and implementing projects.
Self-motivated with demonstrated ability to motivate others to achieve timely results.
Strong leadership and interpersonal skills including communications, facilitation, consulting, coaching, and influencing
Highly collaborative style, capable of working across multiple functional areas to drive results.
Experience with Configuration Control management practices.
Experience with MRP, ERP, Agile Oracle, Windchill, Doors software suites
Experience with NASA, J-STD and IPC standard implementation.
ASQ certification (CQA, CQE, etc.)
Experience within an AS9100 certified business.
Active security clearance
Security Clearance:
Willing and able to obtain a security clearance as required.
   
Please be aware many of our positions require the ability to obtain a security clearance. Security clearances may only be granted to U.S. citizens. In addition, applicants who accept a conditional offer of employment may be subject to government security investigation(s) and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

*Carrollton Python Expert Jobs*The Varsity Tutors platform has thousands of students looking for online Python experts nationally and in Carrollton. As an expert who uses the Varsity Tutors platform, you can earn good money and choose your own schedule while making a fundamental difference in the lives of your students.*Why join our platform?** Enjoy competitive rates and get paid up to 2x per week.* Teach as much or as little as you want.* Share your knowledge with large groups of students.* Instruct online (i.e. “work remotely”) and set your own hours and schedule.* We collect payment from the customers, so all you have to do is invoice the session.*What we look for in a expert:** You have excellent communication skills and a friendly, approachable personality.* You can show subject-matter expertise in Python.* You have excellent presentation skills and are comfortable interacting with groups.*Discover all the ways you can reach students through the online platform:** 1-on-1 Online Tutoring: connect with an individual student for a highly personalized learning experience.* Small Group Classes: meet with small groups (typically 7-9 students) for a more collaborative learning experience.* VT+ Classes: teach groups of 25-30 students anything from math fundamentals to video game design.* Large Live Classes: share your knowledge with hundreds of students at a time.* School@Home: provide support for homeschooling parents with 1-on-1 Online Tutoring and Small Group Classes.* Instant Tutoring: accept subject specific, on-demand tutoring sessions whenever you’d like.*About Varsity Tutors and Large Group Instruction*Our mission is to transform the way people learn. We do this by leveraging advanced technology, AI, and the latest in learning science to facilitate a personalized learning experience. Through large group instruction, experts are able to share their knowledge with hundreds of students at a time and facilitate interaction amongst the students. We believe our thoughtful approach to matching students with the right experts can improve outcomes, and we look forward to connecting you with students hungry to learn. *Carrollton Python Expert Jobs*The Varsity Tutors platform has thousands of students looking for online Python experts nationally and in Carrollton. My client, a growing, family owned, multi-state provider of O&P heath care, is seeking an experienced Orthotist (CO) or a Prosthetist - Orthotist (CPO) to work with their practice, located in Dover, DE.  A practitioner-friendly company, who has been in business for 40 years. Great environment to take care of your patients. Excellent advancement potential within the organization long-term. 
 Recruiter search – candidate confidentiality receives highest level of protection!   
MUST HAVE:
  
Experience: Must be post-residency.  Will consider near entry-level post-residents to seasoned professionals with 20+ years of experience.  
Focus: General practice. 
Education:  A BS degree is a must, but an MS degree would be greatly appreciated. 
Certifications:  Must be ABC Certified.  Having a DE License to Practice is strongly preferred, or a license from another Licensure State.  However, will consider without a license as long as they have the ABC Certification. 
Salary: Negotiable.  $65K to $110K, depending on years of experience and comp history. 
Bonus & Benefits: Bi-Annual Incentive Bonus, competitive benefits, generous relocation assistance.
