Certified Mobile Notary Service ([Link available when viewing the job]) is the #1 nationwide notary signing service job platform that connects valuable companies to Mobile Notary Signing Agents nationwide to notarize mortgage loan documents and general notary work in their local area.
Get ready for a new lifestyle change where you can reap the benefits of financial freedom and a flexible work schedule that you can work around your personal life.
We are informing you that we are now hiring for the Data Entry Specialist remote contractor job position to work directly with our notary department PT or FT.
At Certified Mobile Notary Service our qualified Data Entry Specialists will enjoy the freedom and profitability of working independently as a (1099) contractor while benefiting from the tools, branding, and support of a national mobile notary signing service.
Please apply today at [Link available when viewing the job]  and click on Careers and call [Phone number shown when applying] if you have any questions.
Job Overview:
. You will need to be able to copy and paste (ctrl + c and ctrl + v) various entries into a spreadsheet such as names, email addresses, telephone numbers, and return entries to our HR Dept. via email each week.
. You must be able to toggle back and forth from websites.
. Must have great accuracy and pay close attention to detail.
. Must be able to send out email notification letters to customers regarding products or services.
. You must use a general email client (Gmail, Yahoo, Outlook) to send out our email marketing ads.
Experience and Qualifications:
. You must have strong organizational skills and a positive motivated attitude to get the job done!
. Internet
. Computer
. Quiet home office space setup
. You must be able to pass a felony verification check.
. You must be at least 18 years or older.
. You must be able to work a flexible schedule anytime 24/7.
Location: Work at home or Remote, 1099 Independent Contractor
 
Contractor Compensation Structure:
*Increase and supplement your monthly income!
This position is not paid hourly.  It's strictly paid on production and commissions.
*We pay our remote contractors $20.00 per 4,000 single entries submitted by spreadsheet.
In addition, you will earn a $15.00 commission per sale by sending out our email marketing ad campaigns that generate sales.
* Based upon availability you can work either part-time or full-time.
*Contractors are paid bi-weekly on the 1st and 15th of the month by direct deposit or we will mail your paycheck.
Please reference agent ID CMNSBeckyW whenever you call or sign up on your application. Data Entry Specialist / Full-Time

Array is revolutionizing how businesses leverage and enhance consumer data. Our platform enables innovative companies and developers to seamlessly integrate credit and identity data into their apps, websites or workflows. As a remote-first company, we’re focused on providing opportunities for autonomous individuals to have high levels of impact at the forefront of the fintech space. Continuous improvement, experimentation, and a clear mission stretch us individually and together in service of delivering the best products for our clients and users. 
We build web components (browser custom elements) using vanilla JavaScript and Svelte. We looking for great engineers who know the browser DOM inside & out who want to help consumers with their financial health & wellness via credit monitoring and identity protection. Interested? We'd love to hear from you! And we are always esp. happy to see any pointers you may have to your work on Git (GitHub, GitLab, etc.) or a personal Web site.
Responsibilities
Works closely with the UI/UX team to create applications for high-traffic websites
Profile and improve the performance and scalability of services
Identify ways to improve our technology and process
Participate in code and technical design reviews
Design metrics and dashboards to empower data-driven decisions
Influence the direction of our platform with your own ideas
Job Requirements
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Engineering or Computer Science
5+ years of UI/Presentation Layer hands-on development experience
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Experience working in an Agile + Scrum environment
Experience implementing User Stories and writing unit tests
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Acute knowledge and understanding of the browser document object model
Strong experience with React
Experience with VanillaJS and/or other JS frameworks (React, EmberJS, VueJS)
Ability to create precise interfaces from wireframes or visual mockups using maintainable and reusable code
Understanding of UI design standards and best practices (Material, Semantic, etc.)
Ability to write software that consumes RESTful web services
Mastery of of JSON
Mastery of cross-browser HTML and CSS
Understanding of using Containers and Docker development environment
Thorough understanding of git (we use GitLab)
Ability to keep up with evolving web standards (HTML5, CSS3, ES9+) and best practices
Self-managed developer, also able to work closely with and incorporate feedback from engineers, user experience team, and product managers

Team Member – Breakfast Shift
Opportunity Awaits!
Carrols owns and operates more than 800 Burger King Restaurants, and we need great people on our team! As a Breakfast Team Member, you will help customers start the day right with our delicious breakfast sandwiches and coffee. You will welcome our guests, take their orders accurately and help them unwrap a new day!
What Does a BREAKFAST TEAM MEMBER do?
Serves our delicious breakfast menu to hungry customers
Welcomes the customer, takes accurate orders and manages their payments operating a cash register
Prep condiments and complete set up for lunch business
Restrooms, dining area and kitchen all need to be kept clean and meet safety and health standards
 Our stores get flaming busy! Our Team Members need be able to work as a team in a fast paced environment to keep our guests happy and full. Your part of the team effort includes packaging food and drinks, and making sure the restaurant is clean and maintains health and safety standards.
We always want our customers to be happy, so you may have to answer a question or two, or resolve issues every once in a while.
Our People are Made To Order We are looking for awesome people to be on our team!
You must be at least 16 years old
You must be able to work in a fast-paced environment with your team
Working Hard! The BreakfastTeam Member Position requires several physical demands including:
Remaining on your feet for several hours at a time
Lifting and carrying up to 25 pounds
Manual dexterity as it pertains to pressing and grabbing
Ability to communicate and read
Frequent bending, kneeling, stooping and reaching
Carrols Cares We start our Breakfast Team Members with competitive pay. Have it your way and enjoy flexible scheduling and sizzling benefits!
Carrols participates in the BKC student scholarship program started by the founder, Jim McLamore. Jim believed in higher education and so do we! By awarding over $7 million in scholarships to over 24,000 students each year, BKC plays a big part in making students’ dreams of going to college a reality!
Real Good Food Carrols is committed upholding the Burger King Brand and to serving our customers the exact sandwich they want, made to order and delivered quickly by a friendly team member!
Success never tasted so good! If you want to unwrap your new career in a business that sizzles with potential, and have a great time doing it, click APPLY to submit an application today! Team Member – Breakfast Shift

 APPLY

OVERVIEWLive the experience. From professional empowerment to continual learning opportunities. From ongoing investment in new and emerging technologies to a career of self-determination. At Ulta Beauty, our tech team is critical to our scalability—and is recognized that way. We’ve been defined as a “mature start-up.” A place where interdepartmental exposure, open doors, and genuine collaboration is ubiquitous. Where challenges come fast and furious, requiring agility, mental dexterity, and creativity. Where our passion for better solutions drives us and is core to who we are. 
We’re engineering for the future of retail, and it’s no-holds-barred. But for those motivated by continual change and ambiguity, by superior leadership, by whip smart colleagues who will press you daily for your very best, you’ll find that virtually nothing’s impossible at Ulta Beauty. 
THE IMPACT YOU CAN HAVE: 
Ulta has embarked on an ambitious plan to modernize its data and analytics capabilities and embed a data driven culture throughout the organization. The Data Quality Lead will establish and mature data governance practices such as data cataloging, data lineage, master data management, data quality rules, and profiling, while also possessing domain knowledge in areas such as Master Data Management, Transactional data, CRM & Data Analytics, etc. This person will work with internal stakeholders from various application IT, business, and data governance teams to develop necessary rules, metrics, controls, policies, and procedures as well as automate those wherever applicable, to create a next generation data operations environment, with an end goal of creating high quality data across the organization.
YOU’LL ACCOMPLISH ALL THIS BY: 
Lead data quality team focused on delivering high quality data across the enterprise. 
Develop Data Quality framework & strategy for the enterprise
Identify data quality rules across new initiatives as well as existing applications and datasets
Participates in projects, being the data quality expert, to help identify the requirements around data quality and work with project level data quality resources to implement those
Works with business owners to define and establish definitions and strategies around data quality consistent with operational goals
Collaborate with enterprise data governance teams, technical data leads, data analysts and IT areas to ensure data quality and availability, and to explain the essence and importance of it.
Act as the spokesperson for the importance of data quality and its application to successful business strategies
Oversee the resolution of data quality issues across the enterprise and ensure it is addressed the right way.
Produces data quality metrics and KPIs across various data domains and data assets and measures progress around data quality.
Identify automation opportunities in operational processes around data quality and works with IT and other teams to incorporate those.
Manage and lead small team of Data quality resources 
Ensures adherence to data quality standards and best practices, and reviews DQM deliverables
 
ESSENTIALS FOR SUCCESS: 
A bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent relevant work experience
5+ years Data Quality Management; minimum 2 years as a Data Quality lead in Retail Industry developing and implementing data quality management principles around master data as well as transactional and 3rd party data, especially in Retail industry.
Strongly familiar with key data concepts such as Data Quality Management, Data Profiling, Data Aggregation, Metadata Management, Data Standards, Data Dictionary, and Data Domains
Work with technical and operational subject matter experts to understand and collect metadata about systems, processes, reports, controls, data movement, and business terminology.
Document inventory of current state data quality controls at enterprise level. Review of DQ progress, set new policies/efforts, review system & process changes
Work across development and business teams to understand and aid in data management and governance requirements. 
Perform root cause analysis on data issues and recommend data quality controls to resolve gaps/issues
Measure and monitor – Baseline assessment of DQ, automate tracking and publish regular status (scorecard) updates on data quality progress to IT and business stake holders
Ensure measurable improvement of Data quality by identifying, developing, and implementing innovative DQ capabilities, strategies, approaches, and services.
Knowledge of requirements gathering, design methodology and building DQ test plans and test cases.
Work with appropriate team members to ensure data deliverables are complete and the design supports the strategic data vision
Assess emerging DQ technologies, and make appropriate recommendations based on IT & business needs
Hands-on experience in using Test Management / Defect Management tools like JIRA, Zephyr, Confluence, etc.
Facilitate and document the agreements on appropriate data and its usage.
Ensure all data components are properly integrated and implemented
Educate end users on the value of data and its associated attributes
Provide support and verify data quality through all stages of implementation
Excellent analytical, interpersonal, and communication skills (Verbal and written) to effectively communicate information to customers and to all levels within the organization
Handle multiple projects and assignments concurrently while maintaining high level of quality and effectiveness
Experience with applications and/or infrastructure technologies commonly leveraged to support large scale, multi-platform enterprise environments and distributed systems across diverse geographies
Ability to work independently on initiatives with little oversight. 
Must have strong leadership skills and qualities which enable to work with peers and various levels of management. 
SPECIAL POSITION REQUIREMENTS
Technology & Tools – 
Could Technologies – GCP, Big query, Collibra.
ETL Tools – Informatica, etc.
Reporting tools - Business Objects, Google Data Studio, etc.
Database – SQL server, Oracle, etc.
Test automation Knowledge - Selenium with Java, Web services, etc.
Web technologies – HTML, XML, ASP, JAVA, script, VB script, etc.
WORKING CONDITIONS
Must be able and willing to work off hours and weekends as necessary to meet project deadlines
 
  ABOUTAt Ulta Beauty (NASDAQ: ULTA), the possibilities are beautiful. Ulta Beauty is the largest North American beauty retailer and the premier beauty destination for cosmetics, fragrance, skin care products, hair care products and salon services. We bring possibilities to life through the power of beauty each and every day in our stores and online with more than 25,000 products from approximately 500 well-established and emerging beauty brands across all categories and price points, including Ulta Beauty’s own private label. Ulta Beauty also offers a full-service salon in every store featuring—hair, skin, brow, and make-up services.

PLC- Electrical Technician
 
QUALIFICATIONS                                                                                                                             
Must have formal certifications or education in PLC
10 years experience in OEM integrations
10 Years Industrial Maintenance experience 
Prefer experience with PLC - Rockwell Allen Bradley and Siemens                                                                                  
Essential Functions
Leads and enforces safety regulations by demonstrated knowledge and ability.
Leads and enforces GMP compliance by demonstrated knowledge and ability.
Utilizes good interpersonal skills and maintains excellent interpersonal relationships.
Actively participates in Team Meetings, Production meetings, Project meetings and confers with other Leads, Supervisors, and Managers to coordinate activities of individual departments.
Modifies & troubleshoots programming of PLC’s on process and packaging equipment.
Assists and coaches workers in diagnosing malfunctions in other machinery and equipment as necessary.
Utilizes Microsoft Windows, Word and Excel in report writing and data analysis.
Maintains plant PC network and acts as liaison with Corporate IS Dept.
Initiates or suggests plans to motivate workers to achieve work goals.
Directs and performs electrical, mechanical, hydraulic, and pneumatic maintenance work in repair, dismantling, assembling, and installing and maintaining industrial machinery and equipment.
Diagnoses cause of electrical or mechanical malfunction or failure of operational equipment and perform preventive and corrective maintenance.
Requisitions and keeps supply of spare parts utilizing software.
Listens for unusual sounds from machines or equipment to detect malfunction and discusses machine operation variations with operator or other technicians to diagnose problem or repair machine.
Interprets specifications, blueprints, and job orders to workers and assigns duties.
Establishes or adjusts work procedures to meet production schedules.
Recommends measures to improve production methods, equipment performance, and quality of product. PLC- Electrical Technician

Hybrid onsite/remote We're looking for a Project Manager to lead a data center migration. You will plan, document, and manage the execution of the move with IT manager and business stakeholders.  Due to client requirement, applicants must be willing and able to work on a w2 basis. For our w2 consultants, we offer a great benefits package that includes Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits, 401k with company matching, and life insurance.    Responsibilities of the Project Manager: 
 Develop and document migration roadmap Coordinate internal resources and external partners Schedule and chair regular project steering committee meetings Identify gaps in technology capability versus business requirement Plan and supervise installation of IT infrastructure Identify potential project risks and its implication to the organization and to recommend mitigating measures  Ensure deliverables meet specifications, standards, and quality levels 
Requirements of the Project Manager: Bachelor's degree and at least 9 years of PM experience Well versed in Agile delivery principles, specifically Kanban and use of Jira Excellent knowledge of all aspects of IT particularly complex infrastructure environments Ability to work across all levels of IT and business management Excellent people skills, ability to work with remote teams Ability to stay current on latest IT trends Effective communication skills Strong presentation skills 
Job ID: 362178 About Eliassen Group: Eliassen Group provides strategic consulting and talent solutions to drive our clients’ innovation and business results. Our purpose is to positively impact the lives of our employees, clients, consultants, and the communities in which we operate. Leveraging over 30 years of success, our expertise in talent solutions, life sciences consulting, Agile consulting, cloud services, risk management, business optimization, and managed services enables us to partner with our clients to execute their business strategy and scale effectively. Headquartered in Reading, MA, and with offices from coast to coast, Eliassen Group offers local community presence and deep networks, as well as national reach. 
Eliassen Group is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

job_title: Home Health Aide, HHA -- Middletown, OH $125 Bonus
job_text:
Home Health Aide needed to provide services to clients Middletown, OH.
Working at Interim HealthCare means a career unlike any other. With integrity at the center of all we do, we know that when we support you and your community, you’ll change lives every day.
Our Home Health Aides have been called to care when they’re needed most. As a member of our home health team, you’ll support a full range of patient services to bring comfort and dignity to our clients. 
What you’ll do: 
Assist patients with activities of daily living, such as, light housekeeping, preparing a meal, assisting with personal hygiene, grocery shopping.
Provide companionship and conversation
Teach patient essential self-care skills, as needed. 
Help the patient navigate the healthcare system by scheduling appointments and communicating needs to our nursing team, when appropriate.  
 
What we’re looking for: 
Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA or STNA) or Home Health Aide (HHA) certificate, preferred; 
One (1) year of verifiable health aide/healthcare experience accepted in place of the certifications listed above. 
Attention to detail; able to carefully follow instructions and document notes regarding a patient’s condition. 
Reliable transportation to/from care sites and/or work location.
What we offer: 
Competitive compensation, benefits, and incentives. 
Truly flexible scheduling – a dedication to work/life balance. 
A team environment with a focus on community service.
At Interim Home Care, our patients deserve the very best – that’s why we focus on each individual’s needs in the comfort and dignity of their home. Through nursing, personal care, therapy, case management, and countless specialized services, we bring quality care where it’s needed most. We’re called to care so that family members can be just that.
 #CB

All 1,000 of our Marshalls stores embrace discovery, from designer luggage to statement shoes. Our assortment of brands is always changing, but our mission to provide the surprises that make the everyday a little more fun is unwavering. Just like working here. Everyone encourages each other and embraces the excitement that can come with change. Each shift is a new opportunity to Discover Different.
Posting Notes: Marshalls Store 1199 || 11 Cornerstone Square Suite #700 || Westford || MA || 01886
 Job Summary:  
 Responsible for ensuring the execution of merchandise presentation plans and priorities for assigned departments. Ensures an excellent customer experience by engaging and interacting with all customers, and maintaining a clean and organized store. 
 Responsibilities: 
  Role models exceptional customer service   Creates a positive internal and external customer experience   Promotes a culture of honesty and integrity; maintains confidentiality   Accurately processes and prepares merchandise for the sales floor following company procedures and standards   Maintains and upholds merchandising philosophy and follows established merchandising procedures and standards   Maintains current, fresh, and fashionable features   Takes an active role in training and mentoring Associates on merchandise guidelines, protection standards and established best methods   Ensures Associates execute tasks and daily activities in accordance with store plan; reprioritizes as needed   Communicates accurately and effectively with management and Associates when setting and addressing priorities; provides period progress updates   Processes cash register transactions accurately and efficiently according to established policy and procedure   Maintains all organizational, cleanliness, and recovery standards for the sales floor and participates in the maintenance/cleanliness of the entire store   Provides and accepts ongoing recognition and constructive feedback   Partners with Management on Associate training needs to increase effectiveness   Ensures adherence to all labor laws, policies, and procedures   Promotes credit and loyalty programs during customer interactions   Supports and participates in store shrink reduction goals and programs   Promotes safety awareness and supports maintenance of a risk-free environment   Performs other duties as assigned  
 Requirements: 
  Able to work a flexible schedule to support business needs, including nights and weekends   Superior organizational skills with attention to detail   Capable of handling multiple tasks at one time   Ability to respond appropriately to changes in direction or unexpected situations  
  Team player, working effectively with peers and supervisors to accomplish tasks   Capable of lifting heavy objects with or without reasonable accommodation   Strong communication skills   Ability to train others   One year retail and 6 months of leadership experience  
We’re reinventing retail and helping people discover that next find that’s going to be their new signature look. You can be a part of their journey to look amazing.Our inventory is always changing and our approach is continually evolving, which means every day is another chance to Discover Different. In fact, that’s what it’s like throughout the entire TJX family, which includes TJ Maxx, HomeGoods, Sierra, and Homesense.
Discover Different also means we embrace each other’s differences and unique perspectives. We consider all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, gender identity and expression, marital or military status. We also provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act and applicable state and local law.

Ref ID: 02940-0012043201Classification: User Experience (UX) DesignerCompensation: DOEApply with Robert Half for an immediate User Experience (UX) Designer opportunity in the New York, New York area. This is a full-time opportunity. As the User Experience (UX) designer, you will head user research, the administering of interviews and surveys of diverse populations, and the translation of results into sitemaps, wireframes, and design prototypes. Another requirement for this position is to create the overall functionality of the product and work tirelessly to make incremental improvements to deliver an exceptional user experience. We need a creative thinker who enjoys working independently as well as collaborating with colleagues for this position.What you get to do every day- Collaborating with other members of the digital marketing team on the development of new initiatives- Conducting usability testing on prototypes or finished products to assess the quality of a user experience- Partnering with business users and application developers to translate requirements into sitemaps, user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, mockups, and prototypes- Areas of focus may be content, controls, visual design, packaging, customer/technical support, branding, and other aspects of user experience- Use results from user research and workflow analysis to craft strong experiences for users of a product- Making tools like personas, usage scenarios, site maps, taxonomies, and wireframes- Lending support to other team members as needed (QA, data entry, production updates, resizing of graphics, etc.)- Bachelor's degree - Understanding of prototype/mockup software (e.g. Sketch, Balsamiq, Zeplin) - Skilled in graphic design, video editing, web development, and photography applications such as Adobe Creative Suite- 3+ years of experience within the digital design/UX industry- High attention to detail and possesses excellent organizational and writing skills - A portfolio highlighting UX (wireframes/prototypes/other UX artifacts) and visual design work- Adobe Sketch experience- Command of UX- Comprehensive knowledge of UX/UI Design- Strong familiarity with UI UX And Design- Adeptness in Adobe After Effects- Figma experience- Strong communication and interpersonal skills - Well versed Web Accessibility and testing tools (e.g. Lighthouse, Google Accessibility Developer Tools)- Thorough understanding of design software applications and tools- A candidate with strong interpersonal skills will be the best fit for this positionInnovation starts with people.®

JJob DescriptionThe Executive Office of Technology Services and Security (EOTSS)  is seeking a Senior ServiceNow Developer to join our ServiceNow team and IT Service Management Office. The Senior ServiceNow Developer will play a key role in maturing the EOTSS ServiceNow platform. In addition to development activities, this individual should have knowledge of the Asset, Software Asset, Configuration and Change Management application as well as the concepts used in custom application development. The Senior ServiceNow Developer will work with key business units to build solutions and processes, provide support and maintenance, continual service improvement, and new capabilities on the ServiceNow platform. The Incumbent must have extensive knowledge and experience with ServiceNow. The incumbent must have experience configuring core ServiceNow modules including Service Catalog, Asset, SAMP, IRM, Discovery, Service Mapping. The incumbent must also have strong written and verbal communication skills. Position Responsibilities (including but not limited to): 
 Perform daily administration in support of Incidents and Service Request related to create and managing user accounts, group management, bulk uploads of data and other actives. Develop and deploy solutions for both ServiceNow and EOTSS custom application based on an established SDLC Work with product manager and the ServiceNow architect to maintain an ongoing knowledge of customizations, user pain points and area for improvement Constantly seek out and identify inefficiencies, develop a plan and implement solutions focused on automation and ease of use. Perform ServiceNow implementation tasks including the deployment of update set, manual data movement, integrations, configurations, etc... Maintain the integrity of the ServiceNow tool across production and non-production environments, including the maintenance of mid-servers and integrations. Support the onboarding of new agencies and users onto the ServiceNow platform. Develop clear and concise technical and process documentation, including Unit and User Test Plans as well as knowledge documents. Participate in the upgrade cycle for ServiceNow, including coordination of clones, upgrades and testing (via use of the Automated Test Framework). Support the design of ServiceNow integrations and work with business partners and technical teams on implementation. Maintain an understanding of the current ServiceNow ecosystem within EOTSS, including out of box features, custom applications and integrations to support organization initiatives. Maintain an ongoing knowledge of the ServiceNow product, version upgrades and enhancements, new features, functions and known issues. 
Qualifications:  Minimum 3 years of direct experience as a ServiceNow Admin or application owner Experience configuring core ServiceNow modules including Service Catalog, Asset, SAMP, IRM, Discovery, Service Mapping. Knowledge of the ServiceNow app engine and the process for developing and supporting custom applications Hands on experience in Service Catalog/Service Portal modules. Experience with Advanced scripting, Performance Analytics, Reporting and other use case areas are highly desirable. Experience with Flow designer, Workspaces and UI Designer desirable. Ability to draft and document test plans for both a technical and business user audience. Ability to be flexible, adaptable and learn new concepts quickly. Ability to work effectively in a team environment with aggressive deadlines and multiple priorities as well as the ability to work independently with minimal supervision while delivering results Excellent demonstrable written and verbal communications skill Experience with Microsoft suite of office products – Excel, Word, Teams etc. is desirable  Demonstrates a high degree of customer service and teamwork Good organizational, multi-tasking, and time-management skills Demonstrated understanding of ITIL processes, operations, and procedures. Overarching understanding of ServiceNow Enterprise product suite. ServiceNow System Admin Certification required ServiceNow Certified Implementation Specialist a plus ServiceNow Certified Application Developer a plus ITIL Certification is highly desirablem JJob DescriptionThe Executive Office of Technology Services and Security (EOTSS)  is seeking a Senior ServiceNow Developer to join our ServiceNow team and IT Service Management Office. Software Resources has an immediate job opportunity for a Senior Product Manager (Legal & Compliance). Position is remote and must be local to Seattle, WA, will return to office once restrictions are lifted.   Candidates are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Reasonable accommodations will be considered.   Duration: 18 month(s)  Must Haves: 1. Identity background 2. Compliance and Legal- CCPA and GDPR 3. A/B testing knowledgeable- must be able to tell what is needed  Description: We pride ourselves on delivering the best experience possible to all our guests. Product Managers create the vision needed to deliver that fantastic experience.  We want you to ask why, how, what, when, where, who, again and again. Being curious defines a Product Managers ability to assess a current or potential problem, review the associated details, and eventually provide multiple solutions.  The Identity group focuses on the ability of all guests to move within the platform and experience all available sites, applications, and experiences. Our Product Managers are constantly challenged to make data driven decisions in collaboration with creative and exceptional engineers, designers, and business stakeholders.  Our Legal and Compliance Product team ensures The Company's products and features are in line with global regulations. In this position, you work closely with the engineering team responsible for building the products and features essential to The Walt Disney Company Identity services being legally compliant. Prior experience supporting Legal and Compliance teams in a large organization will be a huge benefit.  What you will do: • Define, implement, and evolve the strategic direction and roadmap for Guests with a focus on Legal regulations within the Identity space. • Good understanding of various National & International guidelines for customer information & privacy laws ( ex. CCPA and GDPR) • Quickly become an SME (Subject Matter Expert) on the Legal and Compliant use of a digital identity across the TWDC platform • Be responsible for guiding the implementation of customer account and profile unification across multiple brands. • Work with Architecture and Engineering teams to guide the design for customer identity and authentication services • Champion the improvement of customer access management for various applications • Develop and implement product strategies consistent with the company vision. • Conduct data-driven competitive analysis and industry research to identify gaps and opportunities that will further inform the product roadmap. • Be an advocate for simplicity, style, usability and represent the voice of the customer in every product discussion. • Work with cross-functional teams to identify business problems, and construct high-level product epics and user stories. • Conduct regular product review sessions, to ensure alignment of stakeholders across departments, business lines, and partner organizations. • Integrate usability studies, user research, A/B testing, analytics and market analysis into product requirements to ensure products satisfy customer needs. • Author detailed product briefs explaining the why and the what for a given initiative. • Deliver crisp product requirements – that are easily understood by technical and non-technical audiences. • Act as the main point of contact for product questions, issues, and feedback. • Refine platform product backlog as needed in addressing delivery impediments or product quality issues. • Define hypotheses for new features and set clearly defined goals and metrics. • Review product performance against KPIs, test and make feature improvements  Basic Qualifications: Required: • Bachelor's degree required in a related field (i.e. Business, Economics, Computer Science, Data Management) • A strong technical, business and/or design background • Proven experience creating detailed requirement documents  Preferred Qualifications: • Master's degree • 5+ years as a Product Manager building digital products and features supporting a Legal and Compliance agenda • Product Management related Certifications  Required Education: BS or equivalent  Don't delay. Must Be Local - NO C2C - NO SPONSORSHIP  DBA - SQL Developer will work with  Engineering & QC teams throughout the product development process, to ensure optimal usage and availability of SQL Server, Writes, refines, and optimizes T SQL code for maximum performance, reliability, and maintainability, Analyzes and interprets advanced storage solution requirements, translating these into efficient frameworks,  
 MUST Demonstrate 5+ years of experience  as a SQL Server database administrator, engineer or developer with strong ability to reverse engineer legacy code at times, improving and refining older T SQL using newer and more efficient techniques, RDBMS backup solutions with cloud architecture and migrations   ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:   Design and implement relational databases and structures as needed Participates in developing cutting edge storage design structures and data processing flows Creates documentation for both new and existing code. :    Intermediate to Advanced level T SQL experience, including query tuning and optimization Experience with Source Control and workflow ticketing systems, SQL monitoring tools (Idera, Solarwinds, etc)  Knowledge of, or experience using, advanced SQL Server functionality (Examples include: service broker, resource governor, temporal tables, query store, Always On, stretch database, etc)

 Intimate knowledge of SSMS, and working knowledge of the other MS SQL Server Tools

ASSISTANT MANAGER
Carrols LLC is the largest Burger King Franchise. We own and operate over 800 Burger King Restaurants. We’ve been in the burger business for over 55 years so we know a little bit about success. We’re all about finding talented folks and giving them the tools and the knowledge to make it to the top.
SUPERIOR BENEFITS...COMPETITIVE SALARIES...ADVANCEMENT OPPORTUNITY! If you’re ready for a job that sizzles with potential, you’re ready for Burger King! While managing a million-plus dollar-a-year restaurant, you will develop business disciplines in Accounting, Human Resources, Training, Marketing, Sales Building, and Cost Controls.
We realize that in order for our managers to be successful in an ever-changing business environment, we must devote time, effort, and commitment to their on-going development needs. The Carrols Management Development Program is the best in the business. The program is well defined, comprehensive, and always on the cutting-edge of new learning initiatives.
Our outstanding benefit package includes, life, medical, dental, and vision insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance, flexible spending plan, company matched 401(k), quarterly bonus program, paid vacation time, personal days, clothing allowance, tuition assistance and much more.
Essential Job Requirements:
Ability to work a 50 hour work week which will include nights, weekends and some holidays.
High school diploma or equivalent
Basic Computer Skills
Valid Driver’s License and Personal Transportation
Out-going Personality
Job Responsibilities:
Direct, control and coordinate subordinates to deliver quality product to our guests in the most efficient and friendly way possible.
Inventory Management
Bank Deposits
Training
Performance appraisals
Maintain a safe work environment for all employees and guests
Other duties as assigned
The restaurant is only the beginning. A commitment to do the best job possible, regardless of the task, is evident throughout our organization. We offer real career opportunities. If you are motivated and want to test your potential, Carrols is the perfect place for you. 
If this sounds like you, and would like to be part of a great team and work with people who care, please submit your resume today.

At Shutterfly, we’re all about people — bringing them together, making them feel welcome, and connecting them to experiences. We make our customers’ memories last a lifetime by capturing, preserving, and sharing them through photography and personalized products. Through our family of brands, trend setting products, cutting edge technology, and best in class customer service, we help our customers, and each other, share life’s joy. Shutterfly is the leader in personalized photo products and services, connecting you with family and friends by sharing your photos in creative and innovative ways. With this brand, our customers can create lasting keepsakes such as award-winning photo books, customized stationary for life’s biggest occasions, and unique home décor.
About You: 
Collaborative, enthusiastic designer with a great eye and aesthetic who is looking for an opportunity to stretch their creative skills and grow in an in-house environment that operates at the pace and mindset of an external agency. Skilled at bringing concepts to life through execution in various digital marketing channels. Demonstrated omni-channel marketing design experience in retail/ecommerce. Ability to own projects through final execution, including creating strong relationships with key partners. Aptitude to photo art direct and retouching direction skills a plus. Proactive and organized, executes work in a quick and efficient manner, with strong attention to detail. 
About Us: 
We’re a Creative Department looking for the right Designer to join our in-house team of ego-free misfits. Our creatives are enthusiastic and thrive in a highly collaborative, sometimes quick-turn environment. Positive vibes only. Well, at least 93% of the time (we’re only human). 
About the Role: 
This Designer works within the Creative Team to collaboratively brainstorm concepts and execute on key projects across channels as identified. This role supports Managing Art Directors and Creative Directors by delivering thoughtful, inspired solutions that engage customers and lead to clicks and conversions. This is an individual contributor position within a growing core team of Designers and Copywriters. 
Responsibilities:
 Work collaboratively from concept to execution—define and bring to life the creative vision, bringing groundbreaking creative ideas and solutions to the table 
 Work comfortably with greater Brand, Marketing, Channel and Merchandise Partners
 Can bring ideas to life via sketches and photo art direction, in addition to design
 Active participation in project Kickoffs, asking insightful questions to gain detail, clarification and alignment with Business Partners 
 Lead innovative thinking, championing better ways to deliver on internal client requests
 Confidently present ideas and concepts to Creative Directors and internal clients (Marketing & Business Partners) with a spirit of collaboration 
 Juggle a mix of long-term and quick-turnaround projects, often with overlapping priorities and urgency 
 Show professionalism in all aspects of your daily tasks, including taking feedback and edits with grace and positivity 
 Be self-motivated  
 Continually adopt new tools and practices as the work evolves 
 Manage work tasks, functions and time sheet using department’s project management tool 
Qualifications:
 Bachelor’s Degree in Design, Graphic Arts, Advertising or Fine Arts highly preferred, but will accept additional experience in lieu of formal education
 3+ years’ experience with a minimum 1 year within retail/ecommerce preferred 
 Portfolio to showcase your skills 
 Hands-on experience designing across a variety of marketing channels 
 Expert Adobe CC and Sketch skills a must
 Conversant with InVision 
 Fundamental knowledge of typography, grid systems, design systems, brand systems, color theory, and composition
 Agency experience preferred   
 Retail / eCommerce experience a must 
 Track record working with loved brands
 Great eye and aesthetic that compliments and elevates the brand
 Understanding and knowledge of advertising technology and digital marketing solutions 
 Ability to prioritize workloads and manage multiple projects simultaneously 
 Be self-motivated and a thoughtful, yet quick problem solver 
 Patience and infectious, positive attitude with a collaborative approach 
 Low ego, balanced with confidence and a healthy sense of personal drive, ambition and ownership  
 A great attitude and flexibility towards business and its ever-changing, sometimes ambiguous nature
 Sense of humor and the ability to have fun doing what you love At Shutterfly, we’re all about people — bringing them together, making them feel welcome, and connecting them to experiences. We make our customers’ memories last a lifetime by capturing, preserving, and sharing them through photography and personalized products. Through our family of brands, trend setting products, cutting edge technology, and best in class customer service, we help our customers, and each other, share life’s joy. Shutterfly is the leader in personalized photo products and services, connecting you with family and friends by sharing your photos in creative and innovative ways. With this brand, our customers can create lasting keepsakes such as award-winning photo books, customized stationary for life’s biggest occasions, and unique home décor.
About You: 
Collaborative, enthusiastic designer with a great eye and aesthetic who is looking for an opportunity to stretch their creative skills and grow in an in-house environment that operates at the pace and mindset of an external agency. Skilled at bringing concepts to life through execution in various digital marketing channels. Demonstrated omni-channel marketing design experience in retail/ecommerce. Ability to own projects through final execution, including creating strong relationships with key partners. Aptitude to photo art direct and retouching direction skills a plus. Proactive and organized, executes work in a quick and efficient manner, with strong attention to detail. 
About Us: 
We’re a Creative Department looking for the right Designer to join our in-house team of ego-free misfits. Our creatives are enthusiastic and thrive in a highly collaborative, sometimes quick-turn environment. Positive vibes only. Well, at least 93% of the time (we’re only human). 
About the Role: 
This Designer works within the Creative Team to collaboratively brainstorm concepts and execute on key projects across channels as identified. This role supports Managing Art Directors and Creative Directors by delivering thoughtful, inspired solutions that engage customers and lead to clicks and conversions. This is an individual contributor position within a growing core team of Designers and Copywriters. 
Responsibilities:
 Work collaboratively from concept to execution—define and bring to life the creative vision, bringing groundbreaking creative ideas and solutions to the table 
 Work comfortably with greater Brand, Marketing, Channel and Merchandise Partners
 Can bring ideas to life via sketches and photo art direction, in addition to design
 Active participation in project Kickoffs, asking insightful questions to gain detail, clarification and alignment with Business Partners 
 Lead innovative thinking, championing better ways to deliver on internal client requests
 Confidently present ideas and concepts to Creative Directors and internal clients (Marketing & Business Partners) with a spirit of collaboration 
 Juggle a mix of long-term and quick-turnaround projects, often with overlapping priorities and urgency 
 Show professionalism in all aspects of your daily tasks, including taking feedback and edits with grace and positivity 
 Be self-motivated  
 Continually adopt new tools and practices as the work evolves 
 Manage work tasks, functions and time sheet using department’s project management tool 
Qualifications:
 Bachelor’s Degree in Design, Graphic Arts, Advertising or Fine Arts highly preferred, but will accept additional experience in lieu of formal education
 3+ years’ experience with a minimum 1 year within retail/ecommerce preferred 
 Portfolio to showcase your skills 
 Hands-on experience designing across a variety of marketing channels 
 Expert Adobe CC and Sketch skills a must
 Conversant with InVision 
 Fundamental knowledge of typography, grid systems, design systems, brand systems, color theory, and composition
 Agency experience preferred   
 Retail / eCommerce experience a must 
 Track record working with loved brands
 Great eye and aesthetic that compliments and elevates the brand
 Understanding and knowledge of advertising technology and digital marketing solutions 
 Ability to prioritize workloads and manage multiple projects simultaneously 
 Be self-motivated and a thoughtful, yet quick problem solver 
 Patience and infectious, positive attitude with a collaborative approach 
 Low ego, balanced with confidence and a healthy sense of personal drive, ambition and ownership  
 A great attitude and flexibility towards business and its ever-changing, sometimes ambiguous nature
 Sense of humor and the ability to have fun doing what you love

At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired.
Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.
Technology sets IT strategy; enhances the design, development, and operations of our systems; optimizes the Wells Fargo infrastructure; provides information security; and enables Wells Fargo global customers to have 24 hours a day, 7 days a week banking access through in-branch, online, ATMs, and other channels.
Our mission is to deliver stable, secure, scalable, and innovative services at speeds that delight and satisfy our customers and unleash the skills potential of our employees.
The Security Software Engineering (SSE) organization has an exciting opportunity for an accomplished Sr Engineer who has an automation and security background to join a high caliber team. The SSE team provides software engineering and automation solutions for Information and Cyber Security. These solutions include process and controls automation, and reporting. The successful candidate will have a well-rounded technical background and experience in SDLC, automation, and multi-domain information security principles.
This role includes leading the engineering and implementation of complex automation solutions for both our internal team and external stakeholders. The qualified candidate will be competent in leveraging various tools and scripting to provide automation solutions, and enterprise reporting solutions. The position will include the following responsibilities:
 Evaluates automation use cases to align the correct solution to each use case. Researches and tracks new  technologies, and analyzes business requirements. Responsible for building high quality automation solutions. Develops specifications for complex automation solutions. Implements and supports enterprise-scale reporting solutions. Provides technical support to users of automation solutions. Interfaces with developers, line of business personnel, information security leaders and managers to identify, define, document, and implement automation solutions into the automated tool suite.
The salary range displayed below is based on a Full-time 40 hour a week schedule:
Salary range is determined by location of the job.
May be considered for a discretionary bonus, Restricted Share Rights or other long-term incentive awards.
Required Qualifications
7+ years of software engineering experience
7+ years of SDLC (System Development Life Cycle) experience
5+ years of Python experience
5+ years of scripting and automation experience
2+ years of technical experience in systems administration, networking, or information security
Desired Qualifications
An industry-standard technology certification
Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to identify and manage complex issues and negotiate solutions within a geographically dispersed organization
Ability to interact with all levels of an organization
Other Desired Qualifications Ability to deliver concise, time critical information to all levels of management, technology and business teams Ability to prioritize work, meet deadlines, achieve goals, and work under pressure in a dynamic and complex environment Ability to influence and build relationships with LOB stakeholders, technology CIO leadership, external service providers, and architecture teams Ability to design or develop automated solutions to business problems Knowledge and understanding of Wells Fargo Information Security Policies Knowledge and understanding of database design, complex querying and data quality standards
Job Expectations
Ability to travel up to 10% of the time

Benefits Summary  
 Benefits Benefits

Company is a venture-backed consumer fintech company that radically reinvented small-dollar loans to make them more affordable and sustainable to help everyone improve their financial health. Building on that success, Company is adding two additional product categories in our pursuit of making financial services more fair and affordable.
Company Finance is seeking to build on the early success with their loan product by expanding into new states and products. As the firm has grown and continues to expand, they now need an experienced leader that can provide the necessary expertise to ensure the company can continue its mission to help customers while ensuring predictable and appropriate returns to investors. They are seeking an analytical, results-oriented, and data-driven Chief Credit Officer than can help them achieve this balance. Reporting to the CEO, this leader will sit on the executive leadership team and become the central point of responsibility for credit performance at the firm. This leader will help develop long-term growth strategies for the loan business that increase revenue, drive great customer outcomes, and build their customer base.
The CCO will own credit policies across the customer lifecycle for the existing loan product and ensure returns are meeting expectations, lead the credit development and launch strategy for the new products, design decision-making processes for strategy changes with credit impacts, design and execute on an agenda of continuous improvement, and educate the organization on the integrated impacts that decisions made in any part of the firm can have on impacting credit performance.
This leader will join Company Finance at an opportune time, as the firm has built a product with high consumer demand and great customer feedback and established a track record of strong funding and investor support. A long runway remains ahead for the CCO to make a huge impact on the growing firm by building a world-class credit organization and defining how it works from the ground up.
This is a remote opportunity, and the candidate may reside anywhere in the United States.
Specific responsibilities include:
Own Credit Risk for Existing Loan Product
* Optimize risk, return and customer outcome tradeoffs through developing credit strategies across the various marketing channels, products and segments. Identify and implement opportunities to expand lending profitably.
* Oversee acquisitions underwriting policy including approve/decline, credit line assignment, pricing and term length. Differentiate credit policy for repeat customers. Develop prequalification process to determine which customers need banking validation.
* Test and evolve terms to optimize while remaining "on-mission" with regard to overall product design and features.
* Drive growth through higher approval rates, higher loan sizes and expanded target population while still maintaining cash collection targets.
Own Credit Risk for New Product
* Build acquisitions underwriting policy including approve/decline, credit line assignment and pricing.
* Build customer management programs to expand and deepen relationships with target customers, including credit line increases, product graduation and more.
* Develop programs to mitigate high risk customers and actions, such as credit line decreases, payment float, authorizations, etc.
* Guide launch strategy to appropriately balance growth and risk management.
Build Out Collections Recoveries and Fraud Capabilities
* Establish collections and recoveries strategies that balance effectiveness and customer experience, including contact strategy, workouts, tools, channels, customer support, agency usage, etc.
* Build and oversee fraud defense infrastructure including models, score cuts, tools, and more.
* Build digital capabilities wherever Company, developing customer journeys and appropriate use cases. Establish the appropriate end vision and build towards it.
* Assess the effectiveness of different treatment strategies for each segment over time and identify the need for new tools and offers.
Define Credit Decision Making Processes
* Establish processes in terms of how changes to credit strategy, policies and other decisions that impact credit quality should be made.
* Define and implement appropriate documentation and scenarios to be evaluated.
* Serve as Chair of credit committee. Define which decisions should be reviewed in committee vs. can be dispositioned outside it. Clarify decision making roles and responsibilities.
Build Tools and Insights that Enable Continuous Improvement
* Develop a learning agenda to be implemented over a multiyear time horizon that provides insights required to optimize the business within segments and over time. Identify appropriate uses for research, analysis and testing. Design and launch inmarket tests.
* Serve as the customer for predictive models, partnering with data scientists to ensure new and refit models are in place as needed to enable the business strategy.
* Lead regular strategy changes to respond to changes in the external environment, new initiatives, variances from expectations and other drivers.
* Identify other key elements of data infrastructure needed to manage and competitively differentiate the business, including acquiring, creating, and refining new data elements.
Manage and Forecast Lending Portfolio Performance
* Set portfolio performance goals, associated KPIs and manage against them. Ensure strong risk/reward tradeoffs.
* Define appropriate risk boundaries and risk appetite that will enable the business to assume a heavily growth-oriented approach that enables future learnings while still protecting against large negative outcomes under various scenarios.
* Forecast the overall lending portfolio performance, including development of loan loss reserves. Improve predictability of outcomes to meet expectations, incorporating the impacts of strategy changes, seasonality, macroeconomic and other external factors
* Design and implement effective performance monitoring and reporting for the portfolio that continuously assess the quality of new and existing loans. Identify emerging trends in portfolio performance and the competitive environment.
* Lead regular strategy changes to respond to changes in the external environment, new initiatives, variances from expectations and other drivers.
Build and lead a high-performing team
* Define the critical skills and competencies needed for success on the Risk team.
* Develop a roadmap to build the team over time, including when to hire in which areas at what levels. Attract and retain high-quality and diverse performers.
Candidates with Relevant Experience May Also Own Additional Functions and Teams Including:
* Operations for Collections, Recoveries, and/or Fraud.
* Data Science.
* Risk management of other categories including liquidity, compliance, operations, data, counterparty, etc
Professional Experience:
 Extensive experience in complex, data-driven problem solving.
 Credit Card or Personal Loan experience required, with a strong preference for both. Experience with additional loan products is a plus.
 Experience leading acquisition credit policy required. Strong preference for experience in additional components of the credit lifecycle including customer management, collections, recoveries and/or fraud.
 Unsecured subprime lending experience.
 Experience building, scaling and leading a credit organization, with the ability to deploy a thoughtful playbook.
 Experience with alternative data and cash flow underwriting.
 Experience in an environment with fully automated decisions.
 Proven track record in driving growth and innovation while managing portfolio performance and profitability.
 Formative experience at an institution that utilizes advanced analytics to drive decisions and manage revenue and risk tradeoffs.
 Experience in a start-up environment. Company is a venture-backed consumer fintech company that radically reinvented small-dollar loans to make them more affordable and sustainable to help everyone improve their financial health. They are seeking an analytical, results-oriented, and data-driven Chief Credit Officer than can help them achieve this balance. Reporting to the CEO, this leader will sit on the executive leadership team and become the central point of responsibility for credit performance at the firm. This leader will help develop long-term growth strategies for the loan business that increase revenue, drive great customer outcomes, and build their customer base.
The CCO will own credit policies across the customer lifecycle for the existing loan product and ensure returns are meeting expectations, lead the credit development and launch strategy for the new products, design decision-making processes for strategy changes with credit impacts, design and execute on an agenda of continuous improvement, and educate the organization on the integrated impacts that decisions made in any part of the firm can have on impacting credit performance.
This leader will join Company Finance at an opportune time, as the firm has built a product with high consumer demand and great customer feedback and established a track record of strong funding and investor support. A long runway remains ahead for the CCO to make a huge impact on the growing firm by building a world-class credit organization and defining how it works from the ground up.
This is a remote opportunity, and the candidate may reside anywhere in the United States.
Specific responsibilities include:
Own Credit Risk for Existing Loan Product
* Optimize risk, return and customer outcome tradeoffs through developing credit strategies across the various marketing channels, products and segments. Identify and implement opportunities to expand lending profitably.
* Oversee acquisitions underwriting policy including approve/decline, credit line assignment, pricing and term length. Differentiate credit policy for repeat customers. Develop prequalification process to determine which customers need banking validation.
* Test and evolve terms to optimize while remaining "on-mission" with regard to overall product design and features.
* Drive growth through higher approval rates, higher loan sizes and expanded target population while still maintaining cash collection targets.
Own Credit Risk for New Product
* Build acquisitions underwriting policy including approve/decline, credit line assignment and pricing.
* Build customer management programs to expand and deepen relationships with target customers, including credit line increases, product graduation and more.
* Develop programs to mitigate high risk customers and actions, such as credit line decreases, payment float, authorizations, etc.
* Guide launch strategy to appropriately balance growth and risk management.
Build Out Collections Recoveries and Fraud Capabilities
* Establish collections and recoveries strategies that balance effectiveness and customer experience, including contact strategy, workouts, tools, channels, customer support, agency usage, etc.
* Build and oversee fraud defense infrastructure including models, score cuts, tools, and more.
* Build digital capabilities wherever Company, developing customer journeys and appropriate use cases. Establish the appropriate end vision and build towards it.
* Assess the effectiveness of different treatment strategies for each segment over time and identify the need for new tools and offers.
Define Credit Decision Making Processes
* Establish processes in terms of how changes to credit strategy, policies and other decisions that impact credit quality should be made.
* Define and implement appropriate documentation and scenarios to be evaluated.
* Serve as Chair of credit committee. Define which decisions should be reviewed in committee vs. can be dispositioned outside it. Clarify decision making roles and responsibilities.
Build Tools and Insights that Enable Continuous Improvement
* Develop a learning agenda to be implemented over a multiyear time horizon that provides insights required to optimize the business within segments and over time. Identify appropriate uses for research, analysis and testing. Design and launch inmarket tests.
* Serve as the customer for predictive models, partnering with data scientists to ensure new and refit models are in place as needed to enable the business strategy.
* Lead regular strategy changes to respond to changes in the external environment, new initiatives, variances from expectations and other drivers.
* Identify other key elements of data infrastructure needed to manage and competitively differentiate the business, including acquiring, creating, and refining new data elements.
Manage and Forecast Lending Portfolio Performance
* Set portfolio performance goals, associated KPIs and manage against them. Ensure strong risk/reward tradeoffs.
* Define appropriate risk boundaries and risk appetite that will enable the business to assume a heavily growth-oriented approach that enables future learnings while still protecting against large negative outcomes under various scenarios.
* Forecast the overall lending portfolio performance, including development of loan loss reserves. Improve predictability of outcomes to meet expectations, incorporating the impacts of strategy changes, seasonality, macroeconomic and other external factors
* Design and implement effective performance monitoring and reporting for the portfolio that continuously assess the quality of new and existing loans. Identify emerging trends in portfolio performance and the competitive environment.
* Lead regular strategy changes to respond to changes in the external environment, new initiatives, variances from expectations and other drivers.
Build and lead a high-performing team
* Define the critical skills and competencies needed for success on the Risk team.
* Develop a roadmap to build the team over time, including when to hire in which areas at what levels. Attract and retain high-quality and diverse performers.
Candidates with Relevant Experience May Also Own Additional Functions and Teams Including:
* Operations for Collections, Recoveries, and/or Fraud.
* Data Science.
* Risk management of other categories including liquidity, compliance, operations, data, counterparty, etc
Professional Experience:
 Extensive experience in complex, data-driven problem solving.
 Credit Card or Personal Loan experience required, with a strong preference for both. Experience with additional loan products is a plus.
 Experience leading acquisition credit policy required. Strong preference for experience in additional components of the credit lifecycle including customer management, collections, recoveries and/or fraud.
 Unsecured subprime lending experience.
 Experience building, scaling and leading a credit organization, with the ability to deploy a thoughtful playbook.
 Experience with alternative data and cash flow underwriting.
 Experience in an environment with fully automated decisions.
 Proven track record in driving growth and innovation while managing portfolio performance and profitability.
 Formative experience at an institution that utilizes advanced analytics to drive decisions and manage revenue and risk tradeoffs.
 Experience in a start-up environment. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Specific responsibilities include: 
 Own Credit Risk for Existing Loan Product 
 
 
 
 
 Own Credit Risk for New Product 
 
 
 
 
 Build Out Collections Recoveries and Fraud Capabilities 
 
 
 
 
 Define Credit Decision Making Processes 
 
 
 
 Build Tools and Insights that Enable Continuous Improvement 
 
 
 
 
 Manage and Forecast Lending Portfolio Performance 
 
 
 
 
 
 Build and lead a high-performing team 
 
 
 Candidates with Relevant Experience May Also Own Additional Functions and Teams Including:

 Experience leading acquisition credit policy required. Strong preference for experience in additional components of the credit lifecycle including customer management, collections, recoveries and/or fraud.
 Unsecured subprime lending experience.
 Experience building, scaling and leading a credit organization, with the ability to deploy a thoughtful playbook.
 Experience with alternative data and cash flow underwriting.
 Experience in an environment with fully automated decisions.
 Proven track record in driving growth and innovation while managing portfolio performance and profitability.
 Formative experience at an institution that utilizes advanced analytics to drive decisions and manage revenue and risk tradeoffs.
 Experience in a start-up environment. Extensive experience in complex, data-driven problem solving. Credit Card or Personal Loan experience required, with a strong preference for both. Experience with additional loan products is a plus. Experience leading acquisition credit policy required. Strong preference for experience in additional components of the credit lifecycle including customer management, collections, recoveries and/or fraud. Unsecured subprime lending experience. Experience building, scaling and leading a credit organization, with the ability to deploy a thoughtful playbook. Experience with alternative data and cash flow underwriting. Experience in an environment with fully automated decisions. Proven track record in driving growth and innovation while managing portfolio performance and profitability. job_title: Luxury Sales Stylist - Contemporary - Saks Fifth Avenue
job_text:
What This Position is All About:
 The Style Advisor is responsible for elevating their shopping experience by welcoming visitors to the store, providing directions and answering questions to help customers efficiently get to their desired location.  The Style Advisor has a strong working knowledge of the store, the designers it carries as well as the many services offered and they use this knowledge to provide customers with personalized assistance to enhance their shopping experience. 
 
Who Are You:
Actively collaborates and contributes to a positive team dynamic 
Consistently generates and shares original ideas, tackling both simple and complex problems
A customer champion who consistently delivers a high standard of customer service and can be relied upon to put the customer first
Acts promptly in routine situations and sees a clear plan of action to a positive result in the customer’s eyes
Demonstrates comfort in flexing all communication styles and establishes positive interpersonal relationships
An out of the box thinker who is comfortable with change and challenging convention
 
 
 
 
 
You Also Have:
 
Technical or other skills such as position specific software
 
As The Style Advisor, you will:
 
Create a Welcoming Environment
Immediately welcomes customers as they enter the area and proactively offers assistance.
Provides a dynamic service presence to each location.
Skilled at asking appropriate questions to identify a customer’s needs in order to effectively provide them guidance or directions.
Knowledgeable of store layout, current merchandise assortment and able to direct Customers to the appropriate area. 
Elevate the Shopping Experience
Able to quickly assess customer needs in terms of: special occasion, vendors/product of interest, special language needs, how much time customer has, etc.
Has a strong network of Style Advisors throughout the store and leverages these relationships to pair the right Style Advisor to a new customer based on the customer’s needs. 
Thoroughly knowledgeable on all in-store services and proactively offers the appropriate service to a customer to further personalize and enhance their shopping experience.
Problem Solving
Demonstrates a high level of energy and the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
Able to understand a customer’s concerns and quickly determine solutions with limited supervision.
 
Your Life and Career at HBC: 
 
Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate
A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance.
Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental). 
An amazing employee discount.
#SaksStyleAdvisor Thank you for your interest with HBC. We look forward to reviewing your application.

Job Summary:
Signature Consultants is seeking a Tableau Developer for an opportunity with a client located Oxford, MA. Our client is looking for the ideal candidates to join the HR Analytics team.
  Required Qualifications: 
3+ years of Tableau Development Experience
Excellent communication skills
Well versed in maintaining, enhancing, and developing new functionality for Production dashboards in Tableau
Manage & Execute defined monthly data refresh process for existing dashboards
Design, develop, and test prioritized enhancement requests
Assess & Estimate new enhancements for existing dashboards
Develop new dashboard functionality based upon business requirements
Basic SQL and MS Access skills
Experience working directly with stakeholders to elicit requirements, troubleshoot issues, and prioritize new functionality/enhancements
Experience working in a large complex environment
Experience in the Agile methodology & sprint cycles
Bachelor's Degree
Nice to have:
Exposure to AWS for data sourcing
Working knowledge of Alteryx and Python
JIRA experience
About Signature Consultants, LLC
Headquartered in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, Signature Consultants was established in 1997 with a singular focus: to provide clients and consultants with superior staffing solutions. For the ninth consecutive year, Signature was voted as one of the "Best Staffing Firms to Work For" and is now the 14th largest IT staffing firm in the United States (source: Staffing Industry Analysts). With 28 locations throughout North America, Signature annually deploys thousands of consultants to support, run, and manage their clients' technology needs. Signature offers IT staffing, consulting, managed solutions, and direct placement services. For more information on the company, please visit [Link available when viewing the job]. Signature Consultants is the parent company to [Link available when viewing the job] and [Link available when viewing the job].
EEO Employer
Signature Consultants is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Signature will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at [Link available when viewing the job] or [Phone number shown when applying].
  Our client is looking for an experienced Tableau Developer to join their HR Analytics team. Qualified candidates will well versed in maintaining, enhancing, and developing new functionality for Production dashboards in Tableau. Ideal candidates will have excellent communication skills in order to work directly with the business, operate on small agile team, and constantly be seeking new and better ways to provide business value. Taking pride in how reports are presented, with a strong appreciation for UX, are two traits essential to a successful candidate.
